reviews.text: I&#39;ve eaten here several times and I&#39;m never happy with the food. The cheesecake is delicious but the food is not worth it for the price. You can eat at another restaurant and feel satisfied for a lot less than what you pay here. But I had a gift card so I thought I&#39;d give it another go. Ordered take out because of the pandemic. There&#39;s a section to park at where they supposedly bring out your food but I guess it&#39;s only for online orders as they didn&#39;t pick up when I called the number listed on the sign. So I walked up to the closed off patio area where customers line up to pick up. She brought my food and I paid and left. By the time we got home the food was nasty. The chicken avocado tomato sandwich my son ordered was a gooey, dripping mess. The bread was saturated and he had to pick out items to eat. The tomato slice was quarter of an inch thick - what the heck? The accompanying salad was average at best. My shrimp scampi was average. The strawberry cheesecake I ordered was the only thing we liked. Overall the meal sucked. Hopefully no one gives me another gift card to this place and my friend who likes the restaurant will not suggest we eat there again.

The Cheesecake Factory is alright I suppose. Every time I try it, I always leave thinking &#34;meh.&#34; First of all the menu is all over the place. Literally way too many choices because the menu is like 12 pages long. Also it&#39;s weird because there&#39;s a bunch of pasta and Asian type dishes, that in my opinion don&#39;t sound like they belong on the menu to begin with. The food is somewhat overpriced, and underwhelming. Again, I can&#39;t stress how much the menu doesn&#39;t make sense. The avocado egg rolls are good, and the cocktails are decent. Obviously the cheesecake is good. To be honest: avoid the food and just go for cheesecake to go. This place isn&#39;t worth the 30 min wait.

I wanted something nice for dinner with family and open after 9pm. So we ended up here. Wait was minimal and got a nice table in back. As always lots of food choices with CF. We also got alot of appetizers before the meal. Food arrived fresh and hot. Everyone was full and had a good meal. Out waitress Heather was polite and handled all our needs and did a great job. We had alot of food be take home since portions were large.<br><br>Only problem I had was with the manager Will on the way out. He and another worker were wiping the greasy floors but failed to tell me to be careful since it was water on the floor. I just thought they were wiping with a dry rag since they were not using a mop. I almost slipped. I told will that they need to be more careful and he just gave me a unconcerned response like we want to get out of here look. Didnt seem sincere when informing him to be more careful. Not sure if he really understood how concerned I was. Was not a good way to end a great meal experience.

I sent this into corporate but they seem to not care enough. This was my experience on a Sunday about a month ago. <br>Unfortunately, I am writing to you about a disappointing experience that I had at one of your stores. We love to visit Cheesecake Factory as a family. I could name a few favorite dishes and cheesecakes we have to have almost every time we visit. My husband and I will not be visiting this particular location again. <br>During our visit last night, I found my family, which includes a one year old who doesn&#39;t sit still for very long and my husband, waiting for our food for an extremely long time(about 45 min) Our server hadn&#39;t mentioned the long wait, but agreed to check on our food when asked. While waiting for his response, a family of four who sat down after we ordered received their food. When our server returned to tell us our food was close to done I asked to speak with a manager. Admittedly a large party (about 8-10) sat down next to us and he came over again after taking their drink order to let us know he had yet to find a manager. It took a total of 15 minutes for a manger to come to our table, which happened to be close to the end of our meal. She didn&#39;t introduce her self, but I was told her name is Rachelle. She listened to my concerns about the long wait and other tables receiving food earlier. The server also had said the kitchen was slow. She did apologize, though it seemed difficult to do so. She agreed to find the source of the problem. She tried to empathize with a one year old screaming for food, though she admitted she doesn&#39;t have children so she couldn&#39;t really empathize. She came back to let us know our chicken Madeira,  salmon and kids chicken tenders all came out of the same area and that&#39;s why it was delayed. I know they do not cone out of the same area for a fact.  She thanked us for bringing it to her attention and left. <br>My frustration is on behalf of our server. Kalon G. Was a great server. He came to the table promptly. He asked if we had questions and took our order quickly. He was polite and seemed to do his job well. He came over after Rachelle left and asked if she offered us any cheesecake. No, I told him, she did not. As a former server, it is so frustrating to serve a table that has an issue out of my hands and then to receive little support from management. I have witnessed first hand, too many times, a manager offer no compensation or solution to a &#34;nice table.&#34; However, at the same time they will hand over all the free dessert and take appetizers off the bill for a table just looking to complain about everything.<br>This poor server did everything right. Most customers would have taken their frustration out on the server through gratuity.(we did not and would not.) I&#39;ve experienced this myself, when an issue isn&#39;t handled by management properly to make the customer feel better and they leave it for the server to figure out on their own. Servers can&#39;t offer cheesecake, only mangers can do that. It seemed that he expected her to at least offer us a slice of cheesecake for waiting so long, as we were sat ten minutes over our quoted time also. To be honest, we had planned to buy cheesecake, but after our experience and the amount of time wasted, we just wanted to leave. <br>I feel this pattern with management that I have witnessed at Cheesecake Factory needs to be addressed. It affects the servers and that affects their morale. It&#39;s in the best interest of the company to know that this is an issue and I hope this can help your teams to resolve these issues and to better serve the guests and employees.
Such a great experience, Tyson was very informative and patient with my allergy needs.

Our server Miranda was the WORST waitress we have EVER had at ANY dining establishment. If you&#39;re being seated and you get Miranda, ask for another waitress or just leave. It&#39;s not even worth the frustration.

Their take out is 2 to 2 and half hours behind. They have one person doing the orders and many many pissed off customers outside as I type this. <br>Cheesecake Factory service tonight was a fail on all fronts.

I have never been to any Cheesecake Factory establishment before, but after this past encounter, I&#39;m glad to say that I&#39;m eager to return. The menu has a enormous variety of options (289 menu items), but alas, I was unable to find chicken strips anywhere . Instead, I decided to settle with the chicken piccata. <br><br>Our server was very affable and was a key component to my dining experience. She was always refilling our water glasses in a timely manner, and replacing the silverware that succumbed to gravity due to the clumsiness of my dear comrade. <br><br>Bathrooms were by far the highlight of my experience at Cheesecake Factory. I eventually needed to use it after the 8 glasses of water I drank, and upon entering, I was greeted with the pleasant scent of lemon that only accompanies that of an immaculately clean facility devoted for the jettison of food waste. I will definitely be making another visit to the washroom on my next encounter with &#34;the Cheesecake Factory&#34;. <br><br>To finish off my meal, I decided to split a cheesecake with one of my dining partners. We ordered Adam&#39;s peanut butter ripple. Although the slice seemed small on paper and in person, it was surprisingly filling for both of us. My only complaint is that the large swirl of peanut butter atop the sloice seemed to overwhelm the bite, both in taste, texture, and stature. I could definitely taste the Liberal in this pie. <br><br>Overall my experience was a positive one, but I did have to dock one star, because I hit a vibe check mid-meal.
Unfortunately this place does not know what reservations mean. According to them it just means put you in front of the waiting line.

This is definitely one of my favorite chain establishments. The variety on the menu is huge and always enjoyable has there is always something for everyone. The staff here is relatively friendly and the food here for me is alwayys consistent. I usually get the salmon miso which I LOVE as it is always cooked just right. Today going I got the chedder burger and it was delicious I loved the onions in it. I will be back for my favorite Oreo cheesecake, as I didn&#39;t get it this time.

The menu is huge but I wasn&#39;t able to find anything that was appetizing. Ninety percent of the menu is chicken! The only burrito on the menu has chicken! <br> Their lasagna was made with spinach pasta! <br>The cheesecake is okay but nothing to write home about so I tried the fudge cake, (instead of eating dinner). That was not all that impressive either. It tasted like it was old and there were chocolate chips on the side of &#34;Fudge Cake&#34;. I&#39;m not a fan of chocolate chips except in cookies, I was only able to to eat half before I gave up. <br>The waiter was nice but all food delivery was very slow even though it seemed like there were wait staff everywhere! <br> I doubt that I will eat here again

Is there any better place to be an adult?  And what I mean by adulting  is skipping dinner and just getting drinks and dessert.  Because not having to waste valuable room for cheesecake on &#34;real food&#34;  is exactly what being an adult is all about.

I love this place. The cheesecake selection is what brings me, although there&#39;s a small chance I&#39;m getting anything other than the lemon meringue. The food is always good but the portions are super large (I believe they have a smaller portions menu now) and the price point is higher, but worth it. I wish the cheesecake wasn&#39;t as expensive as it is, rightfully so, cheesecake is no cheap dessert to make, but maybe it&#39;s good it&#39;s not or I would justify it way more than is healthy. Either way I still love it.
Love bang bang chicken &amp; shrimp.   Made a reservation.  Got there 45 minutes early.  Seated immediately.   <br>Denver Cheesecake Factory is great.

I placed an order on 5/9 for a Mother&#39;s Day delivery at 5:00 PM in 5/10. Understanding the impact of the COVID pandemic, I was willing to give some leeway. However, our food wasn&#39;t ready until 8:10 PM. A 3 hour wait is ridiculous. To top it off, when we did get our food none of the sides were present. Completely missing. Gone. Opened the containers and found that the food was ice cold. Thought it was just the appetizer. But no, the hamburgers (sans sides) were cold as well. Tried to call the restaurant and was hung up on twice. Not once. Twice. All my wife wanted for Mother&#39;s Day was an impossible burger on a brioche bun. What she got was a dinner delayed by hours and a soggy, cold meal without French fries. Kind of makes you wonder why you would want to place an order in advance. I wouldn&#39;t recommend the Cheesecake Factory.

Went for my daughters B-day and had to wait almost an hour to be seated. Items on the menu they didn&#39;t have like really you know you should have everything on the menu your busy all the time. My drink was suppose to be a cucumber lemonade tasted more like a sour lemonade and my first drink only had a slice of cucumber on it after that nothing on my refills or the sugar glaze around the glass. Waiter was friendly and somewhat attentive.<br>Left our daughters wipes and one diaper and remembered soon as we got out the door we went back to go retrieve it and oh supposedly they threw it away but yet the table we were sitting at was still a mess. How rude and disappointing.
I tried the new Mediterranean grilled chicken.  It&#39;s good, but not my favorite thing there.

4 adults, 2 kids, 15 minutes to see a server,  90 minutes to get our food! We talked to the manager, he was apologetic but that was it.  Multiple groups came and went before we got out food.  Over $100 not worth it. We will not come here again.  The staff was standing around gossiping,  while we waited for our food,  absolutely disappointing.  Avoid this place

My best friend took me to the Cheesecake Factory for my birthday celebration.  We chose to order of the extensive Happy Hour menu that was choked full of tasty treats including my favorite thing on the menu their Avocado Eggrolls.... Don&#39;t miss them if you go.. they are loaded with avocado and sundried tomatoes with the most yummy tamarid dipping sauce.  We also had there sweet corn tamale cakes and their southern fried chicken sliders.... all that topped off with one of the best cosmo&#39;s in the city.  Definitely headed back soon!

Made a reservation for noon they made of wait 10 minutes after noon, while they seated people without reservations.  The two of us was seated in the back of the restaurant at a table for at least 6 people.  The waitress arrive with stale bread, we couldn&#39;t even bite into.  I ordered a Cesar salad lettuce was old and brown bad taste,  the shrimp made me sick later that night.  My grandson ordered cheese steak sandwich the bread was so hard it couldn&#39;t be eaten, fries were cold.  Our waitress asked us how was our food we sad bad, asked for the check.  We paid for our food, and tipped our waitress and left the food on the table.  Never eating at the Cheese Cake Factory.

Food is good, but service  is poor. When you try book a reservation you have to use the yelp app. Surprise!! You can&#39;t book a table for 9 people, 6 is the maximum. So if you&#39;re a party of more than 6, sorry about that, you&#39;ll have to do a walk-in and wait a decade!
The food is fine but took a while to take out and in order to get in we had to wait 2 and a half hours. This is just sad.

Come on,  It&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory. I have been to them all over the United States. Good food, well trained staff, great atmosphere. <br>Their sweet corn tamale cakes are to die for. Honestly all the food is top notch. Im not into corporate places. But, if I have to.... Yes, yes I will join friends or family at Cheesecake. YUMMY!

Annoyed. The message on the automated message says to make reservations order take out visit cheesecake <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Ffactory.com&amp;s=1cfe4289e753eb10ec96eb7458d40a8792f39c5526aaf98d6ba6542eb6aac081" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">factory.com</a> or press one to speak to a person. I spoke to someone and now reservations are only made on yelp. Change your message or MAYBE do what most restaurants do and allow the employees you pay assist in reservations of potential employees. The person I spoke to was very professional and polite. So Kudos to you V. Cheese Cake Factory, the only reason your getting stars for this is because of your employee V. I am disappointed that as a 1.3 Billion dollar net worth as a company as of YESTERDAY(<a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.macrotrends.net%2Fstocks%2Fcharts%2FCAKE%2Fcheesecake-factory%2Fnet-worth&amp;s=d3d3e4757f8522430b428acf948cf62f6ef9315435ce40936272c203c5fbbbca" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">macrotrends.net/stocks/c…</a>) you would be able to afford an actual human in assisting potential customers in making reservations.

Out of all the Cheesecake Factory locations in the state of CO, this is hands down the best one. The service is ALWAYS on point. I love the food (come on y&#39;all...the options are seriously endless!), and the variety is also super helpful when no one can decide on where to go! This place has it all.<br><br>I was disappointed to see my favorite stuffed chicken tortillas leave the menu...they were the best! BUT now I&#39;m trying so much more on the menu and I&#39;m happy to say I have some new favorites. I recommend the sweet corn tamale cakes for an appetizer (to.die.for), and if you are looking for a dessert-of-a-cocktail, try the flying gorilla! That banana chocolate milkshake cocktail is ah-maz-zing!!!!

I debated whether or not to leave this review, but my situation was serious since I was sick with food poisoning for one week. I apologize ahead of time for the short novel. <br><br>After an &#34;after the fact&#34; analysis, it was obvious that many servers and/or the kitchen staff had not shown up for work for this mid-afternoon shift. Over an hour wait to be seated, almost an hour wait for my food, and my chicken cutlet was undercooked. Since I had already eaten two bites when I realized the odd flavor was due to the pink chicken, I knew I was going to be sick...guaranteed. The server agreed that the chicken was raw, but I was still expected to pay for my meal. To me, this was a serious situation, but the manager never came out. Looking back, I should have respectfully refused to pay for my meal. Shame on me for taking the passive path. And...Shame on me for not leaving when I sensed the wait to be seated and served was unusually long for a mid-afternoon service. <br><br>If I had been the manager, and my staff had left me dangerously understaffed, rather than tarnish the brand and take a chance on sickening my customers, I would have been honest with every customer who checked in. (Yes, money would have been lost that day, but the reputation would have been protected.) &#34;Due to an unexpected situation, we have a limited staff today. We apologize for the inconvenience, but we do not want to jeopardize your experience by making you wait longer to be seated, wait longer for your food, and most important, it is imperative that your order be prepared properly. If you would prefer to return on a different date when we are fully staffed, here is a coupon for a discount on your next order. If you prefer to stay, please be aware that there may be a lengthy wait.&#34; <br><br>Since there were so many waiting customers (in the waiting area and in the dining rooms), I think I would have been tempted to temporarily close, but I doubt that would have been allowed by corporate. For me, honesty up front would have been greatly appreciated, and I would have respected the company. Instead, I will never go back, but I have also learned a few lessons.

Wasn&#39;t a very great beginning with the hostess and seating and time wise... but ended up to be phenomenal thanks to the manager Michael and our waitress Kim. Both were very attentive and great, took care of us for sure!!! The food per usual is amazing. We tried the smokehouse bbq burger and omg I think my new favorite burger for sure!! <br><br>Again thanks Michael and Kim y&#39;all are appreciated!!!

After calling multiple times to arrange a large group seating, we were told to show up at 5:30 and we&#39;d be guaranteed a seat by 7. We had to wait over an hour after our promised 7pm time. The greeting staff is also very rude and short and even hung up on us a few times while attempting to provide details for our dinner.  If you&#39;ve got a large group, avoid this place at all cost.<br><br>The food is great, but it certainly isn&#39;t worth a 2+ hour wait.<br><br>Post meal edit: the wait staff was great, the food was a bit slow to arrive. Check in time was 5:30. We were sat around 8. Food arrived at table at 8:50.

Cheesecake is alway amazing but the customer service was horrible. We didn&#39;t have anyone in front of us. The boy at the front decided to serve all his friends before he gave us our dessert that was sitting on the counter for 15 min. <br><br>Come on!

Made a reservation and had to wait 10 minutes while letting other people in that didn&#39;t have reservations. Once we got to our table it still had the check and money (which is very unsanitary) on the table.  I then ask the hostess if this table had Ben sanitized and she said yes. Obviously the table was not clean and sanitized if money was on the table. Overall very disappointed in our recent visit.

We got this to go and the only thing that was edible was the bread. The chicken Alfredo was dry, bland, and tasted like warmed up a frozen TV dinner. My girlfriend had the pasta carbonara and said hers wasn&#39;t good either. Pretty disappointed because when I&#39;ve had it before it was really good

As much as I love some of their menu items but the quality is very unstable. <br>MUSHROOM SWISS BURGER is fantastic however They forgot to put mushrooms on mine. Pastas and Salmon is also tasty. <br>This place is pretty much packed and they don&#39;t take reservations so expect a good 30 hours till you get to sit on any hour during the weekend.

We came in last night for a girls night. First off our waiter Grant, was amazing. By far the best service we&#39;ve ever had at the cheesecake factory. Our drinks and food were amazing as they always are. Im mostly just writing this review in regards to our server.

Arrived at 4:30 and was told 30 min wait so we waited 50 min and went to the hostess table and was told it would be another 15-20 min. Are you kidding?!?!  If you are going to tell people 30 min wait, don&#39;t lie and actually mean 70 min. This used to be my #1 GO TO restaurant but I have changed my mind now.

We ate here with family from out of town. The wait was pretty long, over an hour, after we were told about 45 minutes. Once we were seated, service was excellent. Michael was our waiter and he was one of the friendliest, funniest waiters we have ever had. He was extremely knowledgeable about the menu, which was way too long, by the way. We ordered a few items based on his recommendations - the Chicken Bellagio was great, the shrimp creole was good but could have been hotter when it got to me. Staff was on top of refills and checking on us. The cheesecake itself was good, but not great. Overall, would come back based on service more than food quality.

We haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory since moving to Denver and stumbled into this location while checking out the surrounding mall.<br>The food was great. Tasty and filling.My guy chose Jumbo shrimp platter. Twenty pieces, fries and slaw. Boy did he love it! <br>I went with Huevos Rancheros, it sounded yummy and it was.<br>We shared a most delicious Chocolate Mousse cheesecake. Boy, did we get full!<br> The wait time, not too bad, 20 minutes during a busy evening. No complaints with that at all.<br>One thing that was odd, is our server brought our bill right after we ordered dessert .  The cheesecake wasn&#39;t even brought to the table for 20-30 minutes but that bill sure came fast.<br>I think we&#39;ll be back. This location is very nice and there&#39;s outdoor seating.

Sunday 12/8 was seriously the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. I mean, it&#39;s a chain and they&#39;ve been around a while so I&#39;m not even expecting much, but when the service at your local IHOP is better than what you get at an &#34;upscale&#34; mall like Park Meadows, it&#39;s a total bummer. I was visiting from out of town and tried to find a space large enough to accommodate 17 people (friends/family). They don&#39;t take reservations which is beyond ridiculous... So we arrived early (around 4 on a Sunday) and were told we&#39;d be waiting 2 hours which we did because everyone was already heading there and it was a lot of people. I mean literally two hours. Then it was probably another 30-45 minutes to get our food. Our waiter was ok and seemed new maybe, but the waitress we had was AWFUL. When I mentioned that we&#39;d been there over 2 hours already and we&#39;re really hungry, she snottily asked, &#34;Um have you ever eaten here on a Sunday?!&#34; She was super rude when we asked about drink refills (cocktails took forever). More than once she and our waiter complained about how many tables/orders they had. Like, this is your JOB. You don&#39;t complain to your customers if you don&#39;t like it!!? Of course at the end of the night they screwed up our bill and by the END we had been there for literally 4 1/2 hours. What a nightmare, seriously!!! We didn&#39;t want to even attempt to order cheesecake from our wait staff so went to the front and attempted there. No line and about 4 people behind the counter, so I asked one of them if it would take long to order some cheesecake and she said &#34;A minute&#34;, walked away and never came back. I mean...what?! By this point it was kind of hilarious. No one else acknowledged us. We wrangled someone, ordered the damn cheesecake, left, and will NEVER come back! Good grief. Train your staff!

I absolutely love this place! This is the second one I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory, as the first was in Jacksonville, Florida and this restaurant will forever be one of my favorites! <br><br>Me and my son were shopping around the Park Meadows Mall and saw Cheesecake Factory and decided to get brunch. My son made his omelette with bacon and cheese and I had the California omelette. Both were delicious!!! Of course, we couldn&#39;t go there without grabbing some cheesecake so I decided to take home 3. My son picked the birthday cake one and he said it was awesome! I chose the Reese&#39;s, S&#39;mores and strawberry. I was able to try the Reese&#39;s on the ride back home and it just melted in my mouth. It was soooo good! I can&#39;t wait to try the others as I know they will be just as good.<br><br>I love that this location is conveniently in the Park Meadows Mall. Very easy to get to and has tons of parking. We sat on the patio in the shade and it was very relaxing.<br><br>Mykala (I hope I&#39;m spelling her name correctly) was awesome! Very attentive and helpful. And when she went on break she even introduced her stand in server, Christina, who was just as nice. The staff was just amazing here and I honestly can&#39;t wait to get back to try some more of the many cheesecake flavors. <br><br>So many cheesecakes, so little time!!

We went there last night for a birthday celebration &amp; had a great time. We went at 6 and wanted a reservation, they do not take them and I was surprised at that, but it surprisingly was not crowded. We got a nice big table at the back of the restaurant. Plate proportions are fairly large, I split fish &amp; chips (delicious) with a friend and was so glad we did. We both had enough - and got cheesecake to go from the display case as we left. YUMMM. We got a  cute sundae for the birthday girl.  We are all ready to go again. PS we drove from Colorado Springs, so worth it.

My husband and I have eaten at quite a few CF restaurants (and ones that were much busier) and the Park Meadows location is by far the worst. To start the night off we were told the wait would be 30 minutes and it took around 50 minutes (we had to ask, no updates were given), we sat at the table for quite awhile before our server came over, after we ordered it took at least an hour for the main course to come out  (we were a party of 4 adults and 2 children) One dinner wasn&#39;t even ready (they comped a salad), I had to ask for my sweet potato fries, and my impossible burger was fried. Overall the food just wasn&#39;t that great. I have no idea why we had this experience (short staffed, lacking talent in the kitchen, something was missed, etc) but I don&#39;t think we&#39;ll be back until we hear things have improved at this location. (Other reviews sound similar).

Food was good, service good, very accommodating with the toddler with us.  Kids meal was huge.  We were seated next to a window, and had the pleasure of watching security drive by with their lights going about 20 times - not the restaurant&#39;s fault.

HAPPY HOUR!!!! Stopped in today for an amazing happy hour in the bar area (M-F 4:00-6:00). Long Island iced tea. Tex-mex egg rolls with avocado, cilantro dipping sauce that was SO good you&#39;ll want to drink it. Pork belly sliders - soft with great texture and flavor.<br><br>Fresh baked, warm bread and butter is a great start. Pumpernickel and sourdough. Pumpernickel is soft, sourdough a bit chewy, but both good.<br><br>Felt guilty it only came to $20! Joseph, our server was kind and attentive. Great service!

Can&#39;t say enough good things about the cheesecake factory. Always delicious food, good service and good prices. This particular location tends to get busy on weekend nights so we go a bit earlier around 4:00 or 5:00 pm and get seated right away. Their cheesecake is amazing...I always get the tiramisu. Their menu is extensive so it takes some time to read through it all but everything I get is delicious every time. Will keep continuing to come back as long as they are there!

Where do I start??? The service was awful. I ordered the chicken and avocado club sandwich. I asked the server to make sure everything was hot. It was far from hot!!! Everyone else got their food before me. When I got my sandwich back. There was a lot more bread than chicken. She then said some hot fresh fries were coming. I will avoid this place in the future!!!!
It&#39;s impossible to not find something on their menu. Outstanding choices plus cheesecake. Yum yum! W

Came here on Monday not busy at all we were seated right away which is always a plus. <br><br>But waited 10 minutes for a waiter to come over and we had to ask an employee to send us our designated waiter. <br>Ordered finally. Didn&#39;t receive any bread and butter until our food was brought out. <br><br>I got the factory combination which was shrimp scampi and grilled salmon paired with salmon and mashed potatoes. Salmon was great but my shrimp was not cooked all the way through had to spit it out horrible. <br>And it was served with only 3 pieces of asparagus when I ordered a side of asparagus. Never got it<br>My fiancé ordered the Cobb salad he said it was good just way to much dressing on it. <br> <br>I had a Georgia peach drink which I get every time but from this location it wasn&#39;t good.   I had to send back because it was not blended properly it had huge chunks of ice in it and was watered down. <br>For dessert we had the  Godiva brownie sundae. <br>Sent it back the brownie was so hard the fork wouldn&#39;t even cut through it and the ice cream had freezer burn. <br>Ended up with strawberry cheese cake it was decent. <br>$80 later I&#39;m highly disappointed in this location the food was subpar and the service was basically non existent. Never was checked back on had to keep asking other employees to send our waitress over. <br><br>Being a regular at Cheesecake Factory and sister property grand lux cafe. Definitely this location and experience was a let down.

Not good. My wife got cashew chicken. Nothing exciting. Our friends wife got chicken Alfredo, pretty bland. My buddy got scampi shrimp and there was as lot of shell left on the crab. And I ordered steak Diane. The steak tasted like it had no seasoning whatsoever. So bland I didn&#39;t even eat it. They were kind enough to take it away and ask if I wanted something else but with the HUGE menu I just didn&#39;t wanna chance anything else. The veggies and sauce that came with it was good though! Anyways, I&#39;ll skip cheesecake factory from now on.

They do not take reservations for less than a 10 person party per the hostess on the phone. Little disappointed as I have a special needs child and prefer to make reservations to make sure we can meet his needs. Guess we will give it a try ....
If you&#39;re gonna start making terrible cheesecake and making the slices smaller don&#39;t raise the prices.

Always a favorite, extensive menu and always love whatever I get, in the rare occasion I don&#39;t they are very accommodating and switch it out for me without any hassle. The cheesecakes are the icing on the cake. Even if I&#39;m full I tend to order a piece to take home and enjoy later.

Some kind of delivery service should deliver this cake around town...  I can&#39;t find any of the standard delivery services that will do it.  If places around town can delivery hot pizza, cold ice cream, and weed, surely someone can deliver a piece of cake.

Ordered from DoorDash tonight... spent almost $70. They forgot our bread that&#39;s supposed to be included (they almost always do) but take a look at that pasta. NO SAUCE on it! What is that?! So disappointing to wait an hour for our food and to pay so much and that&#39;s what we opened. We also got the avocado egg rolls and pork belly sliders which were ok.
First time here eating at Cheesecake Factory, all in all I was surprised at the variety of Food viands available......<br>Good atmosphere (sat outside) good food, had a good time...

Cheesecake Factory has always been our Go-To when it comes to Family Birthday Celebrations.  A big factor is how quickly food comes out and of course this is a big deal when you have 3 young kiddos. <br><br>We&#39;ve eaten at this location at least 2 times now, and the staff is always great... and the food is on point. Being a regular at other Cheesecake Factory locations (and out of state)... we know when to beat the crowds (basically don&#39;t go in the Evenings or during prime time Eat Times!) so going early in the morning when breakfast starts, after the lunch hour, or before dinner starts have been good times for us (and rightfully so, because a hungry child is not a good thing!)<br><br>The kids love the kids menu... and we always get our calamari fix for an appetizer. My hubby loves the Chicken Bellagio... (which he likes to call the Man Salad... because you get Protein with noodles and a delicious salad). And of course you can&#39;t go wrong with the Cheesecake for dessert! <br><br>We will continue to go to this location.... and are happy with the staff and the food here!
My waiter was super nice and attentive. The food was extremely tasty and my son loved his pasta.

Horrible service!!!. I have been here before many times but this visit was the worst. We have been waiting for 40 minutes after ordered food. And I asked how long we are going to wait and she said one order is ready other one wait for another 30 minutes. While my baby boy was fussing. I cancelled my order. She didn&#39;t refill our drinks and rarely came to us.
Went to cheesecake park meadows to order a drink but they don&#39;t put prices on their menu lol

New review:<br>I&#39;m so fed up with this place. I&#39;m totally boycotting. We&#39;ve been here twice sine my original review and my opinion doesn&#39;t change except for the service. The last two waitresses we&#39;ve had were frustrating to say the least. Today we didn&#39;t even stay for cheesecake because I was just so over the place. I just wanted to leave.<br><br>I despise how they don&#39;t put any cocktail prices on the menu. Today I asked how much a mojito was at it was something ridiculous like $15+ and she didn&#39;t know, she had to go ask. I asked another question about the menu and she was about to go ask again before I stopped her and just changed my order. She also forgot to bring our bread and when we asked for it she looked at us like we were aliens, then it hit her and suddenly all of her tables had bread... I go out to lunch for a good time not to be annoyed. <br><br>Original review: <br>We&#39;ve been here twice. I hate the menu, it&#39;s too big, too much to choose from and then they&#39;re there within minutes trying to take your order - haven&#39;t even got to the 3rd page yet!! <br><br>The food is good and the cheesecake amazing but overall it&#39;s pretty expensive. Yesterday we had just cheesecake and coffee/tea and it was over $25. The previous time it was dinner and drinks and it was well over $100. <br><br>The service isn&#39;t bad, staff always friendly but I don&#39;t like having to ask for cutlery, that should be pretty standard and I felt like the wait for pulling cheesecake out of a fridge was a bit too long, we were almost finished our drinks by the time they came.

UPDATE: Corporate responded with a rude email that clearly showed their lack of customer service extends to their business model. They didn&#39;t even bother to read my actual message but instead decided to educate me on a promo that I wasn&#39;t even attempting to use. I was attempting to BUY food. Not get it for free. <br>*<br>It&#39;s surprising to find out your money isn&#39;t good enough and that you&#39;re not going to be treated as an equal customer because you chose delivery. I&#39;m not sorry I just had a baby and she cant go out to dinner yet. What I am sorry about is ordering from your restaurant. I wont make that mistake again. How dare you treat us any differently than your dine in patrons. I paid more and extra to order delivery AND I expect to get everything I order regardless of your decision to only serve cheesecake to those who came to your restaurant. How does that decision even come to fruition? Oh, they ordered our food, paid for it but NO cheesecake for them?! Then I guess I agree. I wont order your food and I surely wont visit your restaurant.

As others have stated, it was a long wait. It was about a 30 min wait to get seated, which is understandable, since they were busy, but it took about 45 minutes to get the food. The food tasted good, but it was all kind of took temperature. I&#39;d love to give the restaurant another shot during less busy hours.

The food was good, but this is the third time I have had completely terrible service here. The waiter has literally walked by us over half a dozen times without looking or responding to our &#34;excuse me&#34;s. When he finally did stop he wasn&#39;t apologetic and didn&#39;t even seem aware of his shortcomings. There is no manager on the floor ensuring the diners have a good experience. We&#39;ve dined here several times in the past, but lately the frustration with less than mediocre service can&#39;t be excused or redeemed with good food. I won&#39;t be back.
Worst place ever my take out order takes 3hr crazy if you guys cant handle it do not take order......

Brunch? Yes, I just discovered The Cheesecake Factory serves brunch. Their menu is so big that I guess I just bypassed it before. The brunch menu is small but has the necessities. Most items range from $9-$15, typical brunch prices for the area. <br><br>I ended up ordering the Mexican lettuce wraps which I&#39;ve never had before. I&#39;ve had the Asian ones but decided to try the Mexican version. They weren&#39;t bad, they could&#39;ve used more seasoning. The lettuce wrap had chicken, salsa, avocado and stringy radish. I definitely wanted more flavor out of them but it hit the spot. My fiancé had the chilaquiles from the brunch menu. It was really good and lots of flavor, I enjoyed his. We finished the meal with a cup of coffee. Their coffee is very strong so I added more cream and sugar than I wanted to. The coffee was very hot and very fresh. Don&#39;t forget the endless bread and butter, yum!!!<br><br>I definitely want to try more items from the brunch menu since I newly discovered it. Their cinnamon rolls looked delicious too.<br><br>I was surprised we didn&#39;t have to wait for a table on a Sunday morning and our service was fast and efficient. All of the staff was very friendly and attentive.

CAUTION!!! Food Allergies not taken seriously at The Cheesecake Factory. Ordered bang bang shrimp/chicken. Told the server about a shellfish allergy and was assured the restaurant takes precautions in preparing/serving the meals and the shrimp would be switched out for chicken, not an unusual request. The meal was brought to the table loaded with shrimp. Sent it back. Meal was then brought back to the table within a few minutes. Still had shrimp in it! Looked like someone tried to scoop out the shrimp then re-serve it. WTF?! Spoke to a Mgr who did not seem very concerned...she offered to take the meal off the bill and a free piece of cheesecake. Thank you for not asking us to pay for a meal that was served improperly multiple times and not to mention, could have literally killed someone. Anybody with food allergies that still chooses to eat at the Cheesecake Factory, please be careful!

Bread! What&#39;s up with the bread! It&#39;s hard as a rock! I won&#39;t complain about the food, it was good but I don&#39;t want to lose a tooth before eating it. TCF make the change, I&#39;m already giving you half my rent money for my meal, make it memorable not dismemberable! <br>MR.E

As to be expected from a CF, the service was great. We all enjoyed our meals, though it did seem there have been a few menu changes since I was last at a CF, so that was disappointing. I would return to this restaurant.

Customer relations at CF posted a reply to my review (below in quotes). CF seems to do this with a lot of the negative reviews on yelp. It looks like you have issue upon issue with your service and instead of correcting the problem, you post the same message thinking that it will solve the problem. Dear CF, if I contact you on your webpage, what resolution should I expect if I spend some time contacting you there?<br><br>&#34;10/19/2019Hello.  We are terribly sorry you had this experience with your meal.  We know you are  frustrated and we would like to understand more.  Please contact us by going to our webpage - <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fthecheesecakefactory.com&amp;s=0f239aa6becb403dc142324ed160cbf28ef4e238f8e08e9a4d6cd9a8f0b21018" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">thecheesecakefactory.com</a>....   Click &#34;General Questions&#34; from the Contact Category dropdown menu. Thank you.&#34;

I&#39;m an asshole. Don&#39;t care. They have great food here. However, how come it was 1:50 &amp; they told us 20 minutes? 20 minute turned into 20 more minutes AND 20 MORE INTO 20 SO 3:00pm??? REALLY??? LMFAOO WHAT AN EXCUSE.
Delicious as usual. Came here for my daughter&#39;s 10th birthday lunch and everyone was wishing her happy birthday. Food and cheesecake delish as always.
Very good service! Server stayed on top of refills, and checked in with us in a non-overwhelming way. She made sure everything was perfect but gave us space which I love! Also the food was delicious!
The new call ahead reservation policy in placed is great.  No more waiting 45 min to a hour for a table on a Friday and Saturday evening.

The biggest menu ever, but pretty mediocre food. We had a gift card here, so we decided to grab dinner. Otherwise I probably wouldn&#39;t go out of my way. The food was pretty good, but not quite worth the wait. Just a so-so dinner.

We went there yesterday for a late lunch.  I know that Cheesecake Factory always gets busy from going to Hawaii, Los Angeles, San Diego, Vegas locations and we&#39;ve waited over 45 mins, so we&#39;ve learned never to go around the actually time when everyone goes to eat lunch or dinner.  We got there at about 12:50 pm and they sat us within less than 20 mins.  We are a party of 5.  Our waitress was super nice and when she went to lunch she was kind enough to introduce the waiter who was going to help us while she was on her lunch.  We ordered our food and they forgot our calamari, which I wasn&#39;t worried about.  We weren&#39;t in a rush, but they ended up giving it to us for free and the manager and waiter apologized.  We ended up tipping more than 22% since we had great service.  Love this place and its understandable that cheesecake can always be a long wait, but that&#39;s why it&#39;s better to go when they aren&#39;t busy.

They are incapable of estimating wait time.  We were told 50 minutes; we&#39;re at 100 minutes and counting.  We&#39;re committed tonight but never again.<br><br>Finally seated:  it&#39;s 80F,  the bench seats have NO padding, and there&#39;s a huge rip.<br><br>Later:  And, it keeps getting worse:  I&#39;ve had much better food (catfish) at Cracker Barrel for a fraction of the cost.<br><br>On the way out, my friend slipped on the greasy floor.

I mean, everyone has been to Cheesecake Factory, right? It&#39;s what you would expect. Great experiences every time I&#39;ve come here for parties, large group events, dinner dates, etc. Love the food, staff has always been great to me and the location is better than their downtown location. We have been coming here for years.

I had read other bad reviews about this location and went anyhow. That was a mistake. The service was extremely slow despite the restaurant being practically empty. I was greeted promptly and the waitress took my drink order. It took about 7 minutes for her to bring my drink. I ordered a chicken sandwich and fries, over 45 minutes later the manager came out to apologize that they had make my food but it wasn&#39;t up to par so they were remaking it. He asked if he could get me anything in the meantime and I said no. It was lunch so I didn&#39;t need an appetizer between the bread and my meal. The food finally arrived and was just ok. The manager never came back to ask how it was or offer any discount on the bill.

The worst thing about my Cheesecake Factory experience was my pregnant wife wanting to<br>Split cheesecake...the menu is amazing with heathy options and not so healthy options and the desserts menu is one of the best I&#39;ve seen. Soda for $3.25 is a bit much

Terrible service today.  Made a reservation to celebrate a birthday and waited an hour to get our food.  We didn&#39;t get a bread basket until after 30 minutes.  Waitress told us the first batch of bread was burned.  We finally talked to a manager and only gave us excuses . Never coming here again.

Three words: Avocado egg rolls.  Ok yes it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, but honestly it&#39;s the absolute best appetizer I&#39;ve ever had. And of course the cheesecake is delicious.  I had the salted caramel cheesecake pictured below and it was also so delicious and creamy and thick. Yum.

This  was my first dining experience at The Cheesecake Factory. We live in the Springs, and we need a Cheesecake Factory like last year. :)) We put our names on  the list and waited about 15 minutes. We were seated and greeted by a smiling, bubbly Mikaela. We ordered our drinks, and got our drinks and bread in a jiffy. We ordered the lunch portion chicken piccata and the carne asada steak medallions. Both dishes were cooked just right, and was so delicious. We had to get the Cheesecake so we ordered the  white chocolate caramel macadamia nut, and the fresh banana cream cheesecake with hut fudge. OMG- did we enjoy scrumptious cheesecakes!<br>Great service, great food, and great Cheesecake.

Service here is terrible and the manager did nothing to resolve the situation. Our party of fourteen included 4 very small children. After waiting over an hour for food, the kids were wiped out. After eating, the server took his sweet time providing the bill and resolving payment. Two and one-half hours. We won&#39;t be back.

Worse service ever. Besides the long wait before getting seat. Was kore waiting to gwt our ordder, then 44 mins to get our food and food tested horrible and I order cheesecake to go while eatiing my dinner and by the timE we were ready to go the cheesecake was not ready so we had to wait another 45 mins to get out cheesecake. Really ??? And nobody care about all that. No coming back.

So last night we made the mistake of ordering from Cheesecake Factory via Doordash. Let me start by saying don&#39;t waste your time. The absolute BUST on this order was the Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta. They charged us $17 for what turned out to be just a bowl of pasta. There were 3 pieces of broccoli, a tiny piece of eggplant, 1 olive, some oven dried tomatoes, ZERO artichokes, zucchini or pine nuts. We have ordered this dish before and the vegetables were plentiful. This was just flat out lazy and taking advantage of a take out order. Feel free to see the picture below.  I highly doubt anyone from management even cares.

Good cheesecake but, the service is horrible. I have come in here for something sweet many times and the cashier either forgets, or their system sucks for to-go.  10 minutes, 20 minutes then 30 minutes to place cheesecake in a container? We had a gift card and had to use it!

Place sucks. Came and waited and waited only to see 3 other parties of 3 get seated before us even though they came in after us. I walked up to the hostess stand 3 times and even said we would sit outside (although it was Dec, it was 65 out this particular day). She said she wasn&#39;t sure if we could (huh? Aren&#39;t you a hostess?) and she would ask someone. So I continue to wait but the line piles up behind me, so instead of her asking anyone she just stands there. I ask her &#39;So... should I come back then?&#39; And she says &#39;yes.&#39; She never asked anyone, so I come back up 5 mins later (at this point we were told 20 minutes but had already been waiting 30; again, watching other parties of 3 getting seated both indoors and out, while we were left hanging with our 3 year old ... thanks) and ask her if we can eat outside. She still &#39;doesn&#39;t know&#39;, so I ask the guy standing next to her and he says that there is only one waitress outside and not to worry, we&#39;d only be waiting another 5-10 minutes (ok, double the time she originally cited). I go back up about 5 minutes later and say we are leaving and state why. The guy apologizes and says he can now get us outside. I tell him I have to ask my husband cause now he&#39;s ready to go. We end up taking his offer and they seat us at a table that had bird poop on 2 of the seats. I clean it myself because clearly no one is coming back out. The waitress was nice, but clearly overwhelmed and/or new. The kitchen took over hour to get out our food (an omelette and an appetizer!) which is Ridiculous. Management is clearly poor here as I&#39;ve been to CF&#39;s across the country and never seen this sort of incompetence!

We keep coming back here because everyone can find something to eat, especially with dietary needs. However, today will be the last time. <br>First, we needed a reservation for eight with one highchair. The function on yelp would not allow us to reserve more than 6, however as it clearly states on Yelp, we can call and speak with a manager to accommodate. We did, but manager then said it&#39;s first come first serve. Fine.<br>We arrive and we are seated and placed our order within 20 minutes. Not bad. The food came relatively quickly. However, my husband&#39;s food was the wrong order. So the waiter offered soup while he waited another 15 minutes. The soup and his meal come at the same time. Ummm?<br>We finish up and ask for the dessert menu, and remind the waiter it&#39;s our son&#39;s birthday. We wait another 10-15 to order the cheesecake. After another 15, we ask to have the cheesecake to go. After another 15, I leave to wait in the car with our children while my husband waits. Another 15, and he is finally in the car. 1 hour to get dessert? Insane and no discounts!

The hostess service left a lot to be desired as it was disorganized and seemed like they had no idea about how to keep a coherent list. We were kept waiting 25 minutes past our reservation time. However our server, Victoria F. made up for it with terrific service both in timeliness and friendliness. Our experience with her saved what was starting out as a terrible experience. Food was excellent and given the reputation I was happy to see some healthier options.

4 words: Best Shrimp Scampi EVER.. <br>Still can&#39;t forget its perfection. The presentation, the fill of the plate, the cooking technique, size of shirimps. I could never get enough of it.. i wish i could afford to go every day... Everything was divine.. and, of course, the cheesecakes go without saying.

3 stars for slow unfriendly service. The food is good  and the portions are big. The atmosphere is relaxing and the place does get a little loud. The Cheesecake is Very Good. I recommend the bar area for wine and cheesecake. I won&#39;t do the table service until they fix the poor service.

Took the family to the cheesecake factory for a pre-New Year&#39;s meal. Very disappointed in the food quality. The calamari was flavorless breading balls with small pieces of calamari that you could not taste. We had to peel of most of the breading to make it tolerable The Cajun jambalaya pasta advertised very spicy sauce had virtually no spice and was very bland. The crusted parm chicken had a pink sauce that could best be described as a watered down tomato soup with no seasoning. With 200 plus items on the menu I think it&#39;s a little unrealistic to maintain quality across the board.  The only thing worse than the food was the whopping $160 bill that showed up. We will not be going back.

I would come here strictly just for the cheesecakes because they&#39;re just that delicious!  The food on the other hand...not so much.  Ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and a couple bites into my meatballs were really tough and inedible as though they were either over cooked, over microwaved, or just been sitting out for quite some time.

Normally I&#39;ve always had a great experience here. The food is always great, but as of the last time I went I had a horrible service experience. I went out with my friend and girlfriend. Before realizing I was in a same sex relationship my server was great, but on returning to the table where my girlfriend had her arm around me she stopped looking at us. Soon enough our food took over an hour to get to us and it wasn&#39;t even our server who brought it to us. Overall it was a very uncomfortable situation. Watching her bring food to the people next to us, who came in after us was quite unsettling and I didn&#39;t appreciate the experience, especially after I had bragged to my girlfriend who was from out of the country about how great the place was.
Bad service took too long waited over 1 hour for cold food meals came slowly and with mistakes manager try to make it right but it was too late dinner was ruined by bad service and bad waitress

Wow. I honestly don&#39;t think there&#39;s any other way to put it. Me and my friends came for a girls night out after a rough day and we left with happy bellies and smiles on our faces. The customer service was incredible. One of the burners went out and I guess the food was running late but we didn&#39;t even notice! Our waitress was so sweet and even gave us cheesecake and fries on the house for the trouble, which honestly I can say was no trouble at all because they went above and beyond and handled it so well! All I can say is come for an amazing time, good food, and great service! 13/10!!! I highly recommend! Shoutout to my girl Elizabeth W she deserves a raise you hear me Cheesecake factory
Excellent food, (can&#39;t get enough of their brown bread) and great service. Our servers Jennifer and Justin were great!!

Every time I&#39;m in the States for vacation, I always try to hit up the Cheesecake Factory. The outdoor seating at this location is very nice, with comfortable chairs overlooking the sunset, mountains and mall parking lot. We came on a Tuesday night, and there was actually no wait required for a table. The food was amazing as always, I just wish there was more staff dedicated to the outdoor tables. We had to bother our server for more water and bread a couple of times, when we were able to see her. Other than that, food was great as always. The key lime cheesecake was definitely the highlight of the meal.
Food is always good. Service is always good. Grown up drinks taste a bit watered down every time I order so now I just don&#39;t order. But love the food!

Honestly awesome night!! Rachael L out bartender was awesome and attentive!!  Shepherds pie was amazing, and the chicken via something was phenomenal.  To top it off tried some new margaritas tonight which were great!! Worth every penny and 10xs what we spend at other locations we walk away disappointed.   Only downfall was we parked near Dicks and had to walk outside in cold bitter winds to car instead of thru the mall as we entered.   Thats a negative on the mall not Cheesecake.

Delicious! I love to come here accept......<br>The wait it really long. It took two hours on a Saturday night to get a table<br>Very pricey, but the amount of food you get, i garuntee you will be taking home leftovers. <br>The waiters are kind and caring. <br>Food is AMAZING<br>I suggest coming here on your birthday, you get very good decor on the cake.

The food every other time on point but not this Friday night. The corner we were sat FREEZING!!! Finally they fixed that problem (the servers were also complaining) food and apps came out in time but nothing to brag about either under cooked, over cooked and no flavor. Dessert was good for the kids but the shortcake to my understanding was suppose to be warm? I ate some was tired of complaining. 200$ later paid and we called it a night. Plus the took the Cuban egg rolls off the menu one reason I was back kinda sad lol but got the chicken taquitos app and was DELICIOUS! Correction all app we great if was the entrees YUCK! Crab bits, avocado egg rolls, chicken taquitos, firecracker salmon, and potstickers.

Tonight my family and I walked out satisfied by the food but still livid about the hostesses treatment we got before we sat down. I arrived a bit earlier then the rest of my party and went and asked if I could be put on a waiting list at 6pm. It was about 5:45 at the time I asked. A shorter brunette young girl at the counter responded very short and rude and stated that their was currently no waiting list to even put me on. Well it&#39;s Friday night so, I knew for sure the dinner rush was going to start very soon. I told her that I wanted to be put on the list for later instead of taking a table and holding it till my party all got there. She told me to come back and check in 10min. <br>So we ended up coming back like 12 min. Later and the wait was already 20min. Long. Annoyed I gave her my name and she then refused to give us a pager. When we asked why she said because it could be less than 20min so we weren&#39;t needing one. 35 min. Later we went and check on the status. One of the young men who was working next to the brunette was very kind and was trying to help in till the girl practically pushed her way in to find out why were at the counter again. We were than told our table was getting cleaned and would be ready for us in 5min. Fine we waited for 6 min. And decided to check in again. I mean come on it doesn&#39;t take 5 min. To clean a table. Another young man goes to help us and when we told him we were hoping that our table was done he goes to respond that he was sorry but he wasn&#39;t sure what happen to our table.  the brunette is now back pushing her way in to the conversation and starts yelling and having a fit. We demanded to see the manager. This place needs to get it together. The food is great and normally the servers are wonderful, but the fact that they still use a pager system ( at a mall) instead of texting you when your table is ready is annoying, because you really  can&#39;t leave and go shop. And some of the hostesses usually the young females, are normally very rude and look like they are pissed to be working.
Busy place  Food was wonderful. Cocktails were perfect. Depending on your budget if you think it is pricey.

We have eaten at several different Cheesecake Factory locations over the years and they are always professional, the food is great and the staff is very attentive. This location however, is none of those things.  <br>within 10 minutes of being seated our waiter told us he was going to dinner and introduced us to another waitress who would be serving us. Not a soul came by our table for 45 minutes.  I caught the attention of the waitress we were told would be serving us and asked her to check on our food.  Another 15 minutes went by and then some young man who did not introduce himself as a manager?, came over and rattled off some excuse about no one was there to make one of the orders, a salad, and said our food would be right up.  In the meantime a lot of food went out to patrons who came after us , including salads.  Finally 15 minutes later two plates came out.  Five minutes later the last 4 came out.  Now this was our order, 3 club sandwiches, an Asian salad, Chicken parmesan pizza style and lasagna.  The chicken parm was over cooked and the Asian salad had twelve little chunks of chicken. It was mostly lettuce and rice noodles.  The wontons were hard to find also.  We finished and then ordered our grand daughter a piece of cheesecake for her BDay and again we waited 20 minutes. My daughter finally went up front and complained.  At that point a woman came to the table, did not identify herself, we guessed she was a manager, and asked how we were doing and I told her we have had better experiences.  She said she would take care of our bill.  They did take off the Chicken Parm and the Asian salad and the cheesecake.  This was the second time we have had this same experience, so we will not be going back to this location.

I had heard good things about the Cheesecake Factory. The wait was 1.5 hours long so I thought it was going to be good. The food was very disappointing. The meals.came out cold and had to be returned. The server never refilled the drinks once. 1.5 hour from the time we sat down we were served desert so it was a 3 hour ordeal and not worth it with the poor service you receive here. I will be going elsewhere in the future.

Worst service I have ever had. Came in to grab a couple drinks and share some appetizers with my girlfriend and will never go back. Took 45 min to get our drinks, messed up our food multiple times,  and then screwed up the bill three separate times. Took two hours to get just two drinks and two appetizers. One of the managers got involved after about the eighth mistake but hardly even apologized and did not even comp a drink or anything. Many better options in the area, don&#39;t waste your time with this restaurant

Ok, so I don&#39;t have a sweet tooth, &amp; can&#39;t speak to their actual cheesecake.  However, every dish I order here is solid, &amp; consistent.  This is one of my spots I go relax after a tiring mall trip.  Their happy hour is pretty awesome, with generous portions.  I recently had the happy hour Long Island Iced Tea (huge!), &amp; dynamite shrimp.  For entree, I really like the shrimp scampi, &amp; have enough to take home.

We haven&#39;t been here often, but every time we went it was very good. Food was yummy, and oh my goodness, those darn Blood Orange Margaritas. So delicious. Our server was great and attentive. It was Memorial Day and pretty busy, yet we did not have to wait too long. Loved it.

The food, as always, was delicious! It was a busy day so service was slow but the waitress came back regularly to fill our drinks. The food was served warm and tasted great.  I substituted broccoli instead of pasta on my chicken piccata and it was delish! My friend loved her salad too. The only unfortunate part was the crowded bathrooms that could have used some servicing. Other than that - it was a Nice stop!

Hands down, the most welcoming service I&#39;ve ever had. I was happily invited in and found a place to seat quickly. Savannah, our waiter, was super sweet and rushed to our every desire. Me and my girlfriend spent more time talking to her than eating! No, serious, we actually did. She very well may have been the best employee I&#39;ve experienced at any establishment ever. <br><br>5 stars just for Savannah. I don&#39;t know what they pay her, but she needs a raise!

Not surprised on the lack of service. We had a large party of 10 with us. Let me first start off by saying, you cannot make a big reservation past 5:30pm. I&#39;m not entirely sure why but that is their rule. We waited a very long time 45 minutes to an hour on our food. When the food did arrive, it was barely warm. It took a long time for drinks (delivery and refill). Did I mention this was on a Tuesday?

We always seem to run into little problems at this location. First time a few years back (before I started using Yelp!) we dined inside and encountered the dirtiest plate in my life. Oh it looked fine on the surface, but seemed to be unsteady so I turned it a round and a big old chunk of leftover dried-up cheese was stuck on the bottom!!! Ewww gross. How could they miss that? Makes you wonder there&#39;s no QA person in charge of sanitation or even food quality in this establishment?<br><br>This time around, we got sat outside (didn&#39;t even ask if we were OK with that, I always prefer inside) and were served with perhaps one of the slowest servers (albeit nice and friendly). Of course I looked really carefully at our dining ware and there we go again, both of my forks (why is it always me?!?) had crumbs stuck to the tines. Sigh. (while we got free appetizer and dessert last time, they did not even apologize for the dirty forks this time, maybe they&#39;re used to it, it happens on a daily basis kind of thing).<br><br>There&#39;s nothing I can complain about the food. The Cheesecake Factory has consistently good tasting offerings, and I&#39;ve gotta give it to their chef and management for great creations. Sorry the staff at this location is sloppy and is giving off a bad impression. By the way, it was my birthday that day and instead of a free Sundae (I&#39;ve read online several people have received that) all I got was a candle and a Happy Birthday message on my cheesecake plate (what if I hadn&#39;t ordered cheesecake?!?). I felt sorry that I chose this place to celebrate my special day. Not to mention we had to wait like 15 minutes for the cheesecakes and I swear they started to melt a little already.<br><br>The whole dining experience has put us in a worse mood that day and I really did not appreciate it!

Service wasn&#39;t good. They switched 3 waiters on my wife and I. Everything took awhile. We had our usual burger which we had for years and now they have shrunk the size of the patty by a third. The burger used to go out past the bun and the price went up too. It&#39;s more of a kids burger now. Cutting corners. We will no longer be going to Cheesecake factory.

My mom is from out of town and wanted to go to The Cheesecake Factory. I warned her that it hadn&#39;t been very good the last few times we had gone but she persisted. Upon arrival we were seated quickly. We ordered our drinks and mentioned to the waitress that it was really hot.  The waitress told us that the AC was being worked on and should be back on within 20 min. Satisfied with that amount of time, we stayed. A different waiter brought our drinks and spilled my daughter&#39;s water on her lap. He apologized but didn&#39;t bring anything to clean it up. I told our waitress what had happened and she brought extra napkins and apologized. Two of the 5 entrees showed up first. My mom&#39;s Philly cheesesteak bun was as hard as a rock. The waitress took my mom&#39;s sandwich back to get a new bun. Slowly everyone&#39;s food began to be delivered, except for my mom&#39;s. Finally, they brought her entree and it was the wrong order. My mom ate my entree because she was hungry. Finally when her sandwich was delivered the steak was so chewy she couldn&#39;t eat it. An hour and a half later we left sweaty(the AC never worked)and our food was terrible.  We will not return.

We recently rediscovered the CF after being fans in Las Vegas.  This is our go to spot for our family of five when everyone wants something different. We have consistently had very good food here.  Yes,the wait can be long (1.5)hours for us this weekend.  <br>The service has always been good as well with the exception of this last visit.  We had a gentleman waiter who was inattentive, cold and came off a bit snobby.  When you pay $25 per person average and have to wait such a long time the guest experience should be excellent.  Drinks should be full-bread replenished and empty plates taken immediately. Guests shouldn&#39;t have to hunt down the waiter who was conspicuously absent-often.<br>Will we go back? Yes. Will we make sure we don&#39;t get him again.... you bet we will.
For a big chain restaurant that failed report card for their food, also has the worst hostess. They may be pretty but have the worst attitude.. This place better get it together.

First time in Cheesecake Factory in a while.  Flower was our waitress she was excellent.  The food was great!  Nachos and bread were delicious.  Love the skinnylicious menu lots of great healthy choices.  Of course the Oreos cheesecake was to die for!!  Would return!!

Great place to eat, just the coffee cup was dirty but the food was great. The sangria was not that great I&#39;ve had better but the rest of the drinks where good. The most important was the food the food was great.

The staff was nice, waitress was great and the manager took care of us.<br><br>The food however....<br>Ordered the pasta carbonara and the stuffed cheddar burger. We also ordered an appetizer of fried mac and cheese bites. After waiting half an hour (took 15 minutes to even get bread) our appetizer came out, with part of our meal. The pasta carbonara was dried out like it was sitting in the window too long, hardly any sauce and first bite was burnt bacon. Oily, greasy to taste, was not appetizing. 5 minutes later the burger comes out (w/o any fries). It looked ok, it seemed cooked. No. When my friend opened it up to see how it was cooked, was just raw patty. Cheese had clumped like hardened cooled down cheese gets, and bright pink meat. Needless to say we did not eat the food. <br><br>Again, manager and server was great and took care of us. <br><br>Food was horrible though.

Awesome food! Great atmosphere! And so many drink selections. Today I&#39;m getting my hair colored at Tony &amp; Guy across the way from Cheesecake Factory. I put in a Togo order and the gal who placed my order was nice enough to come to T&amp;G to get me credit card and bring it back to me w my food. (Foils in hair can be embarrassing) thank you Cheesecake Factory for the great service!

Excellent food as always. I love this restaurant, which is why I decided to go there for my birthday dinner in January. They don&#39;t take reservations on Saturday nights &amp; ended up waiting for a long long time. I felt bad for my guests. A few of them left before we got a table because they had young kids and could not wait for 2 hours for a table. Which is why I gave it 4 stars. I&#39;d do 4 &amp; a 1/2 if I could. I still love this restaurant.

This is a great establishment that serves a nice variety of menu items. No matter what cuisine you like, there is always something for everyone to celebrate the special occasion. My advice though is to order one entree to split so that you&#39;ll have room for the cheesecake;) the goal is to leave full with no leftovers!

Terrible!!!!  Terrible experience for family and myself!!!  We should have listened to the news report from a few weeks back!  Graded F Park Meadows.  My wife&#39;s Chicken Marsala bow tie pasta was crunchy not cooked. My Farfalle with Chicken bow tie was crunchy as well and the amount of chicken in dish was 1&#34; x 1&#34; piece of chicken. My baby&#39;s macaroni and cheese was &#34;crunchy&#34;!  Just stupid, but here&#39;s where it gets better.  The waitress took mine back and I replaced with tomato basil pasta.  That came back with Tons of crushed red pepper flakes in it. My baby had a bite and cried. I didn&#39;t know why but than I took a bite and OMG!  Burned my throat!!!  My wife didn&#39;t get hers replaced because she told me not to even go there because of the News Reports a few weeks back from Denver News Station Graded F!  Anyways, than the bill comes and they charged for all of the bad dishes that we spoke to waitress about plus they charged me for the tomato basil pasta as well that they intentionally put in a ton of crushed red peppers!!! So messed up!!  We will not be going to the Park Meadows location any longer.  Plus after I post this I&#39;m going to write a letter to Cheesecake corporate office!! Do not go to this location.  Seriously bad!!

What the heck has happened to this place people???? It started with the behind the podium Hostess. Place was slow - a ton of open tables at 3:30 on a Tuesday afternoon- nasty and superior she could not be bothered with us. &#34;You&#39;ll have to wait ... we&#39;ll call you when there&#39;s a table open.&#34; She gestured with her chin over to the waiting area. She turned her back on us so she could finish her conversation with the other hostess. Like being addressed by a supermodel - all attitude. Next was Victoria our server. She was miserable. No hellos no welcoming us to Cheesecake Factory. After plopping us down we didn&#39;t see here again for 30 minutes. We said we&#39;d like to order and she said she&#39;d be back for that in a bit. Ten minutes later she did return. My wife mentioned that we were getting pretty bad service- she shrugged. I half expected to hear her bubblegum pop. We found out that she&#39;d swapped us out with another more cheerful server - without saying goodbye- just &#34;hi, I&#39;m your new server...&#34; oh, okay. All in all the food was just fair. Nothing like how it was in years past. Crapolla experience and just so so food. There&#39;s nothing inexpensive about Cheesecake Factory- at least at Taco Bell they&#39;re honestly happy to see you.

Waitress gave us no refills on water or any drinks, took an hour to get our food we asked to talk to the manager and she was like well I&#39;m sorry I&#39;ll give you cheesecake at the end for waiting so long ... yeah right. I got the wrong drink and the waitress was like oh my bad then got a different one and that one was trash and when I told her she had a whole attitude. When we got our food it was cold. My food had HAIR in it and my friends food was BURNT. At this point we were just done. We asked to see the manager again and this lady completely ignored us and never shows up. So we ask for the check and mine still had the drink that I didn&#39;t even drink on it and she didn&#39;t even split it. (She didn&#39;t even ask if we wanted the check split). Oh and the floors were super slippery and there was only one caution sign at the front... needless to say we never got the cheesecake the manager promised and we&#39;re never going back there again. First time and last time eating at the Cheesecake Factory.

My son&#39;s buffalo wings were RAW in the middle. We told the waitress, but no manager came to make it right or apologize. The waitress just said she would take it off. When the waitress brought the ticket it did not remove the wings so we had to make her aware. Im worried about my son and husband that ate some of the wings!! What if they get food poisoning and y&#39;all didn&#39;t take it seriously?!? My husband&#39;s pork chop and my daughter&#39;s chicken strips were over cooked. My lagnasa tasted funny. We also had to wait a long time for this horrible meal. I suck it up and go because my family likes going, but we won&#39;t be coming back to the Park Meadows location and question going to any other Cheesecake Factory for a VERY long time.

What a disappointment!  I ate here with my grand daughter&#39;s for lunch. It was the 10 year olds birthday. She got nachos. We&#39;ve had them before here and they were delicious- not so this time. They were left to sit under the lights until all the cheese was melted into a greasy mess at the bottom of the plate and the tortilla chips were dark brown and nasty. Toppings were almost nonexistent. Worse though was that although I told our wait person that the 3 year old had a very bad shrimp allergy and that as a precaution we could not order anything for the table that had touched shrimp or been fried in the same oil as shrimp, it was not until my Mexican eggrolls, which turned out to be soggy with grease, were brought to the table, that I was I told  they  were fried in the same oil as shrimp!!!!!   We waited a long time for such poor food. Our server tried and thank goodness he caught the eggroll/shrimp contamination issue before I gave the youngest any. I know he told the kitchen upon ordering. I blame the kitchen for the entire mess. They did take the nachos off the tab but the whole meal should have been comped. They lost any future business from me or my family. And we eat out a fair amount and have not had any other shrimp contamination issues provided we tell the wait staff. So if other places can get that right, why can&#39;t CCF???

A few months ago after dining at this restaurant the manager who ran my credit card gave it to another patron in error.  It took nearly 45 minutes to locate my card which was not only frustrating as we were there with a 2 year old that was losing his patience due to the lengthy wait but also scary as they had no idea who they gave my card to and at one point tried to tell me they had given it back to me and I must have lost it (while I was sitting there at the table?)!  After they discovered their error the server handed me a gift card in the amount of $25 and advised they wanted to compensate us for the inconvenience.  I did not solicit anything and was not even sure I would return to the restaurant due to this breech of my financial information.  However, we decided to give the restaurant another try tonight and guess what....they told me there was no money on the gift card!  In fact, the general manager Steve Cordell actually told me the card did not come from their restaurant but was instead one that is purchased in a retail store and had in fact been activated back in 2017 and redeemed in 2018.  I explained that a manager from his restaurant gave me the card and I have never in my life been in possession of any other Cheesecake Factory gift cards and certainly did not purchase it in 2017 as I just received it from them in the last year.  Mr. Cordell pretty much insinuated that I was a liar and was trying to perpetrate fraud on them!!  I was embarrassed as we were pretty much sitting on top of another couple at the table next to us and they could hear the entire exchange.<br><br> I can tell you for a fact I will never return to this restaurant and doubt I will ever step foot in any other Cheesecake Factory either as they clearly have management issues!  It was a manager who initially lost my credit card and gave me a fake gift card and tonight&#39;s GM Steve Cordell should be in another line of work as his customer service skills are deplorable!!!!

A very unremarkable visit to the Cheesecake Factory chain. It was Friday so we expected a wait, and it was only 20 mins. having missed the main rush. We ordered the sphagetti, jambalaya and sliders. The meals took about 40 mins to come out. The jambalaya was delicious, spaghetti was average, and the sliders below average (White Castle is even better and not as pricey).  I actually took some of the jambalaya veggies to give the sliders some taste. Ended the evening with some red velvet cheesecake, which was delicious.

So we were invited to join friends celebrating a birthday tonight and I was hopeful things had improved, however we experienced another sad meal experience.
