Our orange chicken was worse than old Chinese food and our friends meal didn&#39;t show up until the rest of us were almost finished eating. My wife&#39;s cheesecake was the smallest piece of cheesecake we&#39;ve seen there. Very disappointing once again. <br><br>The Factory has always been a favorite family spot for us, especially for special occasions, however our last two meals here over the past 6 months have been sorely disappointing. We know to expect a long wait, 1 hour 15 minutes last night, but normally expect the quality of food and service to make up for the wait. We celebrated my wife&#39;s birthday last night and my shrimp scampi had no flavor at all and the angel hair pasta was dry as if it had been under the warmers for way too long. My wife&#39;s chicken maidera was also flavorless and chicken rubbery. Our granddaughter&#39;s chicken was also so rubbery it was hard to cut with a knife. Sadly we won&#39;t be back until we see the ratings improve

Very nice setting for a casual dinner. I had the country omelette with potatoes and bacon. Others ordered the chicken with lemon couscous which looked really good. We had a firecracker salmon appetizer which is unique and really good with a soy based sauce.

Yikes! It was a rough visit. We had a reservation for 10 at 530. They sat us right away and that was about the best thing about the night. I food took almost an hour, when we got it many of our plates were cold.  We had a dish with a hair in it, so that was gross. The cheesecake was good, that&#39;s about it. Will not go back to this location

TL;DR overpriced, understaffed, really slow.<br><br>Early Sunday (4:00 pm) dinner. Seated right away and wait staff was prompt, but after that services were very a joke...it took 20+ minutes for 3 pasta dishes and a burger. We had to flag down staff and ask for each drink refill, we were &#34;empty&#34; most of the meal. The &#34;mildly spicy&#34; peppers in the pasta were so hot she couldn&#39;t finish the dish. We came because we wanted dinner and then the famous cheesecake. The meal and services was disappointing enough that after the main course we just paid and left, and got cheesecake to go at the walk up counter. And we *STILL* had to wait almost 10 minutes while the counter staff messed around with the point-of-sale system.<br>Really poor experience for what was decent but too-much food and substandard services.<br>Receipt had a gratuity suggestion list that went up to 22%...Hah.

If you haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s got the ambiance of a finer dining restaurant but definitely made more accessible (in price, location, etc.)<br><br>I&#39;ll go through some of the highlights. <br><br>It&#39;s a cozy, dim lit restaurant with both indoor and outdoor seating (however the outdoor seating is very exposed to all the traffic coming in from the mall parking lot). It would be cute for a date (I think I went to a Cheesecake Factory before prom?) and could be appropriate for a more business-y lunch.<br><br>They&#39;ve got free bread! <br><br>As far as entrees go, their potions are big! I almost always go home with left overs. <br><br>Of course, the cheesecake is good, but far too often do they drop my go-to Cheesecake (the latest disappearance being the White Chocolate Blueberry Swirl). So if you&#39;ve been missing what may be considered a seasonal flavor cheesecake, don&#39;t take it for granted! <br><br>If you&#39;re bringing kids, you&#39;ll find a cheesecake they like too. They have more rich, chocolatey flavors like snickers, reece&#39;s, carrot cake etc and some more subtle ones as well, like tiramisu...or just straight up original, no surprises Cheesecake.<br><br>Like I previously mentioned, they are in a mall AND they just very popular, so expect a good amount of traffic. Take that into account when making dinner plans!

My mouth waters when I think of The Cheesecake Factory.  I love LOVE their food.  We share a meal as their portions are HUGE and with the bread and drinks...even while sharing there is usually any room to spare for the CHEESECAKE (which really shouldn&#39;t be missed).  <br><br>OK--their wait time is OBNOXIOUS.  I mean really...no reservations?  90 minute waits?  That is ridiculousness.  At least do call ahead seating.  For the upscale situation they are presenting, they really should be more accommodating in this way.  More than once...more than SEVERAL TIMES we&#39;ve left because of the lame wait.  <br><br>However, if you get lucky enough to get seated, enjoy the food and savor the savory dishes they offer.  <br><br>My Favorite Meal:  <br>Appetizer: Crab Cakes or Boston House Salad or Avocado Egg Rolls (to die for) <br>Entree:  Chicken Bellagio or Chicken Madiera<br>Dessert:  Lemoncello Cream Torte or Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake<br><br>EAT UP!

You should know that Cheesecake is one of my favorite places to eat and I picked to get ToGos for my birthday, out of all places. I ordered a dinner size salad, and if you know Cheesecake Factory, you would know their portions are huge. They very obviously gave me the small appetizer size and it is SIGNIFICANTLY smaller. I&#39;ve been ordering this same salad for years. Literally years. The Togo lady even asked me to double check what size salad I wanted. And you still got it wrong. I paid for the closer to $20 salad and obviously didn&#39;t get what I paid for. I&#39;m beyond disappointed and skeptical to ever eat from this Cheesecake again. Thanks for ruining my birthday dinner.

Excellent time had and our food was delicious. We were a large pastry and everyone was satisfied with their food selection. Kid portions are big. Our server was knowledgeable about the food and preparation. The cheesecakes were Devine ! The location was I attached to the mall in park meadows.colorado

Had the unfortunate occasion to eat at this restaurant with my family. Let&#39;s just say it was the worst experience we have ever had at a Cheesecake factory.  Server was a total space cadet, manager was dismissive and condescending along with a bunch of goofballs workin at the host counter.  Furthermore I thought the floor was wet in the place but I&#39;m thinking now it was just a thin layer of grease everywhere making it feel slippery like it hasn&#39;t been mopped since it was erected. <br><br>My order was wrong twice, the second time it wasn&#39;t even cooked. My daughters meal was wrong as well. We have been to Cheesecake Factory all over the place from DC to California and this is the worst one ever. If you can avoid this place like the plague. <br><br>Oh and their cheesecake was warm too, how does The Cheesecake Factory mess up cheesecake!<br><br>Drive on Yelpers!

I have been 2 times now, both were not great. I left wishing I would of saved the money I spent. the food is overly greasy, took a long time, and just wasn&#39;t of high quality. I don&#39;t know if the chain itself is getting worse of if it is this location, but I wouldn&#39;t recommend it. P.s. Half of our 8 person party got their food while the other half took an extra 10 min to come out, and only did because we had to speak with another waiter about it... its the worst to have to eat cold food just to be polite for others.

Service was lacking, but I do not have a Cheesecake Factory where I am from, so I never pass up the opportunity to get cheesecake when I am near one.  My friend and I had dinner at The White Chocolate Grill, but I wanted to get cheesecake to take back to my hotel.  We walked in, there was a gentleman standing at the counter waiting for his order, and there was a lady behind the counter.  We looked at the cheesecake and when we decided what we wanted, we walked up to the counter.  The lady was busy, but after a few minutes, she walked away.  We stood there for 3-4 minutes just waiting (if I had a cheesecake factory at home, I would not have waited).  Finally someone came to take our orders.  She prepared my friend&#39;s order, but when she went to give her the credit card, the lady said no, I can only prepare, I can&#39;t ring you up.  So, she took my order and started to prepare my order.  Another 2 minutes go by and finally another person came and checked us out.<br>This is the very first time I have ever been into a Cheesecake Factory (in the past 10 years) that service at the cheesecake counter was so slack.

Got to say, this is an average place. Our server Krista was amazing, but the food here was totally average. And when you&#39;re getting standard food and the plates cost $20 bucks a pop, why really bother?<br><br>The drinks are the trick here - you ought to realize something is sketchy when there aren&#39;t prices next to the drinks on the menu. Every cocktail on there is between 11-15$. Sure, they tasted fine, but for gods sake, what a waste of money! The prices here aren&#39;t worth the average food and drink in my opinion. It&#39;s a fine place to eat and drink though if you want to spend the money. 2.5 stars - totally average.

Two stars because they tried, but it was an epic fail despite. Ordered an appetizer, they didn&#39;t have the dipping sauce so they brought it out without it. The avocado egg rolls are not the same without the dipping sauce..... then we ordered. From order to good we were an hour and ten mins, then my food came soggy and everything had obviously been sitting. Mine got sent back, with no offer to fix so I shared a meal. A manager finally came by and was apologetic and offered some cheesecake. We decided to order it to go because we had 4 children under 7 with us who were done. Get home, two people missing their cheesecake order! I guess it was a nice gesture, but I ended up with no dinner and no cheesecake, and lost nearly three hours of my life. Sad!

I don&#39;t review on Yelp a lot but this time, I just can&#39;t take the service here anymore.  First of all the server doesn&#39;t pay attention that much to our table as she barely came and checked on us.  She then later took a 30-minute break, in which I&#39;m fine because I don&#39;t really wanna deal with her.  What we ordered was the BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad which took almost half an hour to get it.  When our salad got on the table, we found that there is no chicken in out salad and we knew this because we ordered this item almost everytime we come here.  This is very disappointing and we will never come back to this place again.

Great food, great atmosphere. The staff always do a good job with the wait times and getting people seated. However, a couple times I&#39;ve been there the food takes a little long to get to our table. Other than that, love this place. Cheesecake is amazing, glad it&#39;s located near me.

I typically like the Cheesecake factory with its humongous menu and friendly service. However, this experience was really a bummer. <br><br>I was considering ordering the Spicy Cashew Chicken dish. I&#39;ve had my eye on it for a while and decided to ask our server about it since I was afraid it would be sweet (like most dishes similar to this one are). She assured me that it was not sweet at all but rather, was savory and had a nice spicy kick to it. Sounded good to me! When it arrived, I took my first bite and much to my dismay, it was VERY sweet. Not only was the sauce too sweet, but the rice was not cooked properly and was like a mush under my chicken. <br><br>She asked how I liked it and I told her not at all (this was towards the end of our meal, otherwise I would have ordered something else). I told her that the dish is in fact sweet and she said, &#34;Yeah, it is a little sweet, sorry I didn&#39;t tell you that in the beginning.&#34; I&#39;m sorry too, because I asked about it specifically! I think it was just a matter of not knowing the menu item very well. And how could she? There are hundreds of items to learn and remember! She should have at least been honest with me and said she didn&#39;t know. And, on top of that, she didn&#39;t even make an attempt to remedy the situation. No offer to take it off the bill and no offer to get me something fast to-go. Such a bummer.<br><br>I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever be back to this location (not necessarily because of this experience but more so because I actually live in San Diego and only visit Colorado Springs once or twice a year) but I thought it was worth sharing since the service was especially lack-luster.

Had a wonderful dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. We visited on a Tuesday night after the usual dinner rush, therefore there was no wait. The hostesses were absolutely great. I&#39;ve never been welcomed so well into a restaurant. They were very nice and accommodating. <br>Our server Levi was great. He was super attentive and had thorough knowledge of the menu (as tough as that seems!) and offered to us his favorite dishes as well as check up on us a consistent but not pushy amount of times.<br>The food was spectacular. The chicken was perfectly grilled, veggies nice and crisp, and the mashed potatoes were heavenly. <br>The cheesecake, dulce de leche and a recommendation by Levi, really hit the spot!<br>Would definitely recommend after a long day of shopping :)

Horrible service. Waited a half an hour for a chicken salad sandwich and cup of soup. Manager was no help and offered no excuse. No wonder this place is on many lists of declining restaurants.  Never again.
Stopped in for a quick dinner with my hubby, happened to be happy hour.  Great food and awesome service.  The drinks were great and well priced as were the happy hour apps!

I went here with my sister, my 3 young kids, and a friend of ours who was visiting from out of state. Service was absolutely slow for a place that wasn&#39;t particularly busy on a weekday afternoon. We had to ask for their complimentary bread twice for my more than hungry kids because of the long wait to order and receive our food. They didn&#39;t even offer it the first time around like most Cheesecake Factory(s) would do after placing a drink order. <br><br>Our friend&#39;s salmon was dry as my shrimp tacos tasted extremely plain. I felt like I was eating a flavorless salad with random bits of unseasoned shrimp. My children shared a chicken pasta dish with my sister (I forgot what their dish was but it had lots of cheese), which they all seem to enjoy besides the chicken that my sister said the pasta itself can do without. <br><br>The only pro is the portion sizes were large to share with everyone and take home leftovers. I can&#39;t say much about our waitress who ended up handing us over to another to go on break.<br><br>I would probably only come back to get a cheesecake to go. More than two hours of mainly waiting is enough to not bring us back again.

We self-seated in the bar area. Ordered them waited nearly an hour for our food. Fish &amp; chips came out cold and tasteless. Shrimp scampi at $22 was 8 shrimp and an appetizer plate sized pasta. Was compensated by a piece of free cheesecake. Woohoo!!  Was the worst waste of $100 I&#39;ve ever spent on a meal. Not recommended!!!!

Went for our anniversary, ordered avocado egg roll, drinks, fries, Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp, Chocolate Tower. <br><br>Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp was pathetic, shrimp was not cooked properly, it was chewy and without flavor. Chocolate Tower was worst as it was having too much bitterness and baking powder taste. Completely ruined the planned meal for the day.. not coming back again..

Still one of my all time favorite restaurant. Huge selections to choose from. We were seated immediately, we opted for outside seating since the weather was nice. Our server was extremely pleasant and lovely. Ordered the fried calamari, Thai lettuce wraps and the factory combo: Diane steak and chicken miedera. Love this place and will continue to come.
Vacationing in the Denver area and ordered a vegan burger, l have been vegan nearly 8 years, hands down the worst bite of vegan burger ever. Trash fodder.

I really don&#39;t know how anyone can complain about this restaurant. My husband and I eat there a couple times a month. The food is consistently good and the service is never lacking. This location is always clean and usually there&#39;s a wait but that&#39;s because it&#39;s one of the more reasonably priced restaurants in the area. Another perk is that the food is upscale but it&#39;s also child friendly.

Excellent service &amp; Cheesecake. But !  I called for reservations &amp; was told it had to be over 5 ppl. Our party of 4 waited for over an hour. Not good plus the food is way to expensive. Will only go back for Cheesecake.<br><br>Thank you for responding to this post. Good customer service to try &amp; resolve issues. We may try again, love the cheesecake !

I had read all the reviews of poor service and we have been here before, but it had been a few years. We visited for my daughter&#39;s 19th B day. Our waitress Elizabeth H. was great, she was honest answered questions, knew the menu, told us what she thought of certain dishes which was a delight to me. Service was 5 star! I ordered the gumbo &amp; it was exactly what I expected not the best, but pretty good for a non-Cajun place.  My family ordered Ahi tar tar, lunch salad (huge), Thai noodle dish and chicken fingers. All were very good and the bread was warm and it was all good. Thank you! Very pleasant time!

Not the usual Cheesecake Factory....they&#39;ve changed the menu not so friendly waitress cleaned my table off when I made a quick trip to the bathroom and our main entree had not arrived...they took EVERYTHING off the table our drinks bread appetizer silverware it was like we had never been there...they did reset our table but no more appetizer no more bread...will never go back to another Cheesecake Factory
Nicole was an awesome waitress.  We had a 16 top and she handled it flawlessly.  Every single person in our party was happy, and she had other tables as well.  Thank you Nicole!
Apparently when you make a reservation... it&#39;s a pretend reservation.   A large group... birthday.. with time restrictions.  AND ... zero accommodation.  Not the first time

The pizza was burnt but we tolerated it coz we were starving..let server know politely.. she&#39;s like ok but,&#34;are you full though&#34; uhh show your attitude somewhere else,she then brings in a tiramisu that&#39;s smashed, we just didn&#39;t want to eat that,let the manager know as well..he went to bring another one but we were done.. We&#39;ve had both the BBQ chicken pizza and tiramisu at Cheesecake&#39;s before, but never like this..maybe will just venture the one in downtown from now ;D (Sorry forgot to take pictures of the smashed tiramisu and plate full of burnt pizza crusts)

This was my first ever visit to the Cheesecake Factory. The menu was huge-- which is both a blessing (lots of choices) and curse (probably not made fresh every morning). I had their chicken salad sandwich with fries, and my boyfriend had their bacon hamburger. He loved his burger, and I really liked my chicken salad sandwich. The portions on both meals were exceptionally generous, in my opinion. They served both with and brown bread before the meal, and I really loved their brown bread! They had a wide selection of coke products, teas, and lemonades. We also had their chocolate fudge cake. We split one piece, and it was huge! The service was great! We had a wonderful experience. My only complaint (if you want to call it that) is that with such a huge menu, you can tell a lot of it isn&#39;t fresh. I struggle to pay $12-18 a plate when I&#39;m getting frozen French fries. But overall, it was great (especially the cake!)

My worst restaurant experience today! I fully understand a lunch rush and we excepted a wait, but not two hours...at 2pm! After waiting 30 minutes for just the bread and water at our seat we where approached by our waiter. We asked to take our order so it could finally get worked on, but before my friend even got to ask for a side of french fries while we waited she walked away. In the middle of ordering she assumed we where done and walked away!! We then continued to wait another hour for our food! We almost left, but stuck it out! Bad choice, the waiter never came by to check if we needed more bread, refills, or to update us on our food. Once the food finally came out it was not only warm, but my friend could not eat hers because it was so bad. There where no apologies or even concern for us as paying customers. Not only did we waste our money, but also two hours of what was suppose to be a nice afternoon.

Don&#39;t like waiting over 45 minutes for my food?  How about you? Is this reasonable? Don&#39;t think so, therefore this place sucks for that.  Slow service is a sin against paying customers.  Why do you let it happen? SMH

Had the white chicken chili, terrible, came out cold, had to reorder, the second had mostly chicken grizzle, the waitress was spending her time cleaning, saw what was happening but never asked seeing the pile of grizzle I put on the bread plate, no manager in sight <br><br>Lack of management at this estsblishment

After a wait of 30 min on a Sunday....we decided to grab an open high top and were instantly greeted by our server, that came to be...Nicholas. He was absolutely fabulous. The entire experience was fab. He was observant to our needs and our app and dinners came out spot on. He was adorably cute too. Definitely 5 stars. The 4 stars was only because of the extreme lack of attention at the host/reception area but once Nicholas took care of us, we were happy. Thank you!
We had a wonderful time!! Came with our fussy new<br>born and our server Brandy was fantastic at making us feel welcome and getting us everything really quickly. Definitely coming back soon.

For the quality of food and service this place is just not worth the wait (on weekend) or price. Service was painfully slow and seemed chaotic even though they appeared to be well staffed.<br>Our bread was hard as rock, macaroni and cheese balls were cold, and our entrees didnt come out right. The burger my husband ordered well was medium rare at best, and the sauce was vile, and the fries were cold. We ordered salads that for some reason came out literally 3 or 4 minutes before the entrees.<br>Our drinks werent refilled until we were done eating and my son ordered his pizza half peperoni but the whole thing was peperoni. <br>We ordered cheescake to go and 2 of the 3 were tipped over and our slices were small for 8 bucks. Definately smaller than they used to be.<br><br>What a bummer! I mentioned these things to our waitress and she said sorry but didnt actually do much to fix it- except she did have my husbands burger cooked longer- but all the other issues werent addressed. A manager didnt come by either even though we were so disappointed with every course of our meal.<br><br>I dont reccommend.
I waited 59 minutes for a table have been seated for  almost an hour and still no food, very unimpressed with the service.

First time at this location.....was somewhat disappointed with the food. We ordered fish and chips, both were warm, not hot. The fish potions were small and thin. The chips we&#39;re just barely warm. On the other hand we also ordered a steak with mashed potatoes, both were hot and well prepared. Our server was right on top of things through the meal, but was not much help with the fish .

We came here for dinner and got sat pretty quickly. Our server was wonderful very attentive to our every need. Food was good cheese cake was wonderful. I like the atmosphere only downside is it can be pricy.

Yes it is just like other Cheesecake Factories, but thanks to Nate or waitress we had a wonderful experience.   <br><br>There were three of us that include my wife, myself, and our 2yr old. Nate was great to offer good recommendations (Chicken Bellagio, awesome!). She was very attentive with our order, drinks, desert, and check. Overall she is the reason for the five stars, oh, and the food too. Thank you Nate.

The wait was only 7 mins for a table for 8 guest. this was on a Saturday afternoon. Out waitress was AMAZING, fully attentive, friendly, great conversation and check up. The food was great as always. Recommend this location to everyone

Just had lunch here! <br><br>The wait was short, however after our pager lit up it was a additional 5 minute wait. No exaggeration. <br><br>The place was packed! If I hadn&#39;t had a gift card for this place I would have turned around and bolted. <br><br>All the tables for two were RIGHT next to each other. We all might as well been at a community table together. I was tempted to try everyone&#39;s cheesecakes since they were in fork distance!!<br><br>We each had the bbq burger, rare. Yum!!!! I recommend. I had salad with mine and hubby had French fries. The salad dressing was good! I would had been satisfied with a big one of those only. <br><br>I asked waiter if they had a salted caramel cheesecake (I hate menus, too many choices), sadly they didn&#39;t have one. <br><br>I looked at the menu and the fourth one down was a S&#39;mores cheesecake. Score!! No need to look further, this was the one. And it was heavenly! <br><br>I&#39;d return, but during off busy hours!

After waiting for 35 minutes for a table we were sat by the kitchen which smelled like just that, a restaurant kitchen. When I asked to be changed to somewhere else because the smell was causing me severe nausea (past occupational hazard + so is infection) I was escorted up front by the waiter who clearly did not care at all just to be told we would have to wait yet another 15 minutes. So we had to go back to the table by the kitchen. Zero accommodation or even care. <br>The people that I came with were both minors so for obvious reasons they had to eat which is the only reason I opted to stay. I unfortunately could not even order food to eat because I could not tolerate the smell. <br>To add fuel to the fire we had the displeasure of having to hear and tolerate people smacking dishes around, dropping things, and waiters getting their orders together right next to our table. Quite literally our worst eat-in experience. <br>Extremely disappointing.<br>We will not be returning and do not recommend this location as a place to sit and eat. Spend a couple of extra dollars and go to The Seasons.

Service and food was still really great. I took a few stars away cuz they got rid of the Firecracker Salmon Rolls on the recent menu change:( I was just here in August. At least I got em one last time. Sad news!

Truly dreadful food tonight. We had a large group and almost everyone was disappointed with the food. The service was good as usual but the food has gone downhill over the last year. Sooooo not worth the premium price. Many of us had french fries with our meals and they were all cold and hard/chewy like they had been sitting somewhere for a bit. The serving sizes appear to have gone down. Child&#39;s meal came about ten minutes after 12 other meals arrived. Just not good and I can&#39;t imagine coming back for anything except cheesecake. Used to be good food but not so great anymore.<br><br>And Mr. Manager that responded, if you view our review on Zomato, you&#39;ll see that this isn&#39;t the first time we&#39;ve had almost the same mediocre experience.

The Cheesecake Factory has some of the most ill-mannered and impolite front staff. Nobody that greets, unfriendly faces, 0 smiles, 0 boundaries. This is also related to other locations. I don&#39;t honestly know what&#39;s going on. It&#39;s almost like dating a pretty girl who wears a lot of makeup and then she invites you with her mad makeup skills, but her personality is crap. This is how I feel about this restaurant. Pretty on the outside, and much to be desired on the inside.
We had a mess up with our order. Our server brought the manager, Michael over to speak about it. He was very very thoughtful and understanding. He took the meal off our check. Amazing service!!!

Came in today for lunch by myself at the bar. The whole restaurant was packed, but the bartender kept up with an impressive level of service. Everyone I saw today from the staff maintained a high level of professionalism in the midst of chaos! Great work!

We just celebrated our oldest daughter&#39;s 15th birthday and the service and experience were stellar! BJ was our server and he was so kind and very good. Kept our glasses full and offered my daughter an amazing custom hot fudge sundae with some.singing too! All four meals, appetizer and desserts were A+! We&#39;ve been to CF several times before, this one and many other locations. This was one of the best!

Upon a long day of shopping, decided to go to an old standby   Took too long to get water.  The waiter was too arrogant as if he were the king of the CF.  A little maturity would have helped.<br><br>Food was served at a good temperature.  Saved room for the Cheesecake.  Dessert was reasonably priced, but other foods a little high in price.<br><br>Good food, stressful service.

I&#39;m doing a update review of the previous review... as per response to the person who responded... a salad is a salad... it doesn&#39;t require much work... there is no defense for that than just being lazy cooks... sometimes you only get one chance to prepare food correctly... are you going to make excuses if you serve under cooked chicken or give people food poisoning... there is no excuses for this... if I have to keep flagging down a waitress or waiter when I&#39;m already Hungary and I already had to flag them down for a missing item because it wasn&#39;t prepared correctly like the description stated; or as your continuing to eat notice it&#39;s dry there is no dressing; then who made it, shouldn&#39;t be making salads... if they can&#39;t make a salad they are no cook and should be fired! NO EXCUSES!!!

This is a normal go to for really good food, great service, at a fantastic price. Last night we ate dinner at the Park Meadows mall location. The waitress didn&#39;t come to our table for over 20 minutes and served people around us prior to asking for a drink order. Ended up choosing two pasta dishes. My pasta was so Bland it was like eating noodles that have been cooked out of the box with a little bit of oil tossed on it. My son&#39;s pasta was actually excellent. Between the bad service and the disappointing food I decided not to even bother with cheesecake which is always outstanding. It will be a long time before I choose the Cheesecake Factory again for dinner or lunch or to recommend it to anybody else.

Sitting at the table of &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; I am genuinely confused and startled by the general theme of the restaurant. It gives off a cold and unpleasant vibe to it. Also I asked the lovely waitress for one serving of avocado egg rolls and I received the cold remark of &#34;we are out of avocado egg rolls&#34;. Now I&#39;m upset, why are you &#34;out&#34;? Can the cooks not simply make more? Instead I settled for a plate of nachos, and it has been almost 16 minutes and I have not received my nachos and I have still not settled on a theme. I am not mad, just disappointed. Still confused.<br><br>On a positive note, Cheesecake is pretty great. Thank you.

I was a little disappointed with this place in the beginning. The wait time was only 30 minutes for a party of two, that wasn&#39;t bad. They called my name and told me to step to the side and my host would be right with me. Me and my fiance had to wait almost 20 minutes before we even got seated. They forgot to call my name and just threw it away. We finally got seated and I order a old fashion, let&#39;s just say it was very disappointing, but my second drink was a whiskey sour and I must say it was amazing. I order a ribeye steak, green beans, and French fries. The ribeyes was the only thing good, green beans should have been cooked a little longer, and the fries were not seasoned at all.

Some items on the menu are pretty good but others are just terrible. I don&#39;t even remember when was the last time I had to send back a dish, but it happened to me here last week. The manager came over and said he&#39;ll have the replacement dish I order &#34;right out&#34; but it never came so after a long wait we had to cancel it. Obviously it wasn&#39;t on the check but I would have expected some more here. We didn&#39;t pay for it because we never got it so we ended up paying in full - no compensation at all and we never saw the manager again after they messed up. This was for my daughter&#39;s birthday so I kept cool, did not want to ruin the night for her but I doubt we will ever come back.

The food was not good.  My daughter ordered the New York Strip and it was chewy.  I had a burger and it was bloody.  The fries were stale and when they brought new ones they were so salty I could not eat them.

Went here for a nice and somewhat quick dinner. The wait when we arrived seemed long but it was only around 10-15 min before we were seated. Waitress was professional and took care of us throughout the meal.<br><br>Ordered Avocado Egg Rolls as an appetizer, the sauce pairing is to die for. Fiancé ordered Thai Lettuce Wraps while I got Baja Chicken Tacos. The food was good but nothing special. <br><br>We used to like it more before they changed the menu and got rid of some items and changed recipes for others. The Tex Mex Egg Rolls used to be my favorite item on the menu but they changed the recipe and got rid of the avocado cream sauce that previously came with the dish.<br><br>***If looking to eat healthy check out the skinnylicious menu, the food is quite delicious and the portions are still generous***
Cheesecake is my favorite thing here by far.  Guess that makes sense.  Huge menu with lots of options. I just come in for some cheesecake to go.

Been to Cheesecake Factory many times, always disappointed. The food is just ok, nothing is &#39;great&#39;. The portions are just too big, it makes you feel bad to not finish. <br><br>I think my biggest gripe is with the host/hostess stand. They are incapable of making an adjustment or decision on the fly. Not only have they frustrated me, but I witnessed another party walk out because the host couldn&#39;t figure out how to seat them in an adjacent table because that section was &#34;closed&#34; - the table they wanted to sit at was about 15inches away. Ridiculous!<br><br>Decided today 8/28/16 they we won&#39;t be back.
Terrible terrible terrible. Received a burger with two slices of ice cold cheese and mashed potatoes that weren&#39;t even room temperature.

We just celebrated my daughters 8th birthday with Sunday brunch and had the worst experience. We had a semi large party of 13. I will start with the single positive and it was our wonderful waitress who was kind and caring and attentive. She wasn&#39;t even the normal waitress just the one covering someone&#39;s breaks. <br><br>Now the meal: they changed the recipe on the monte cristo and it was absolutely inedible. The bread was slimy and undercooked and completely saturated in uncooked egg. The huevos rancheros ordered with eggs over medium the egg whites were not cooked, when sent back they came out a second time not cooked. The eggs Benedict eggs were hard boiled and the French toast was not cooked. The eggs and bacon plate with eggs over medium came out with runny whites of the uncooked eggs. The meal was inedible to say the least. Not a single dish was served even warm everything was cold. Out of 12 dishes not one was hot and 6 were not edible. 7 of us have to eat again now that we have left.<br><br>The general manager came out swinging telling me the meals were cooked like they always were and never once apologized. I have had brunch here numerous times and later the manager admitted the recipes had changed. The general manager was incredibly rude, short tempered and did not resolve a single issue. Our kind waitress was grossed out at the uncooked eggs but the general manager did not seem concerned in the least. He is the reason we will never dine here again and we will tell all of our friends and family of this experience.

My wife, her grandmother,  and I went to this location on January 31th.  We had lunch and dessert on this occasion. Michael S. was our waiter and he hit out of the park. Giving great recommendations, prompt service for food, and we got everything we could ask for as taste.<br><br>One recommendation would be for the front of house: the manager and attendant were pushing some people to the front of the line that were local celebrities. It is not a good idea to favor those who waited in line as opposed to those who have been there or have a reservation.  Unlike the local celebrities who did neither.  Could have been a 5 star visit, must knock you 2 stars for that.

There needs to be a different system. I called ahead for my cheesecake order - like two days ahead - to avoid chaos. Inside - complete chaos. ONE person running a register while the line was 10 plus deep, with more coming in the door. Three - literally - three people standing behind the counter not doing a darn thing. One &#34;runner&#34; - there has to be a better system. What I do know is three people ended up leaving and not ordering so money out the door. Figure out that system before Christmas - it is the most inefficient thing I have ever seen

I use to love, but no more. My family ate here at least 2-3 times a month in the past. I went here for the last time a few weeks ago. Bad service, cold food, sloppy presentation, and worst of all, my waitress was clueless. I asked to have my food boxed up to take home, and she picked up my plate and sat it on a stack of dirty dishes from another table. YUCK! Needless to say, I didn&#39;t eat that. <br>Also, one of the last times I was here the hostess forgot us! We waited over an hour for a table and watched people who checked in After us, be seated before us. When we asked the hostess, she insisted we had just checked in 20 mins prior.... And she was rude!<br>So disappointing.... I use to love this place! BUT NO MORE. It&#39;s amazing how much a manager can do, or not do. <br>This place is going downhill.......

Me and my daughter came into this restaurant. It was a 30 minute wait which I am completely okay with since this is a busy and popular restaurant. Me and my daughter were seated and ended up waiting 30 minutes before I had to get up and find someone to see if we could get some type of service. A manger walked by while I spoke with a waitress. The waitress was kind enough to take our order knowing our table was not in her section. Several waiters walked passed me and my daughter who had no drinks or bread for the table. I have been to this restaurant several times and have never felt so dismissed. If I could give a half star for our experience I would. Very disappointed.

We got a couple cheesecakes to go! We got the new birthday cheesecake and we were expecting it to be too sweet but it was light, fluffy and delicious. We also got the original cheesecake and it was perfect as usual. We also decided to try the mango key lime cheesecake and that was my favorite. Out the three cheesecakes we got I definitely would get the mango key lime over every other one!!

Worst experience ever!  My porkchop was overcooked, my wife&#39;s lasagna had a strange taste and worst of all the buffalo wings my son ordered were raw!  You put my son&#39;s life at risk but no visit or apology from a manager! Wont be coming back here. The wings were comped at least but my son didn&#39;t get to eat very much, then they failed to remove the raw wings from the ticket and had to mention that again.

I just went to dinner at the cheesecake factory this past Saturday.  The wait was 30 minutes and we were eager to chow down so we waited.  What a big mistake.  Granted it was Saturday at 5:30 pm so it was really busy.  But our experience was so bad I asked to speak to a manager.  When the manager arrived I explained that my friend and I sat down first.  Then came a family of 4 and a woman with three teen age girls.  So we all got water and bread and that is all we got.  The family got their dinner and was on cheesecake when I asked for the manger.  The teens ate cake first then got their entrees before us.  The manger said he would check the kitchen to find out why it took so long to get our meal.  He came back and said our meals took 40 minutes to prepare because the pasta station was backed up.  However, the teens had pasta and they got served before us.  He said their entrees only to 35 minutes and he thought it was okay that they ate before we even saw our meals.  We declined to stay and the manager never even offered to compensate us for the inconvenience. I will not eat at the Park Meadows Cheesecake Factory in Lone Tree again.  Checking some of the other reviews I see that this location is poorly managed.

When I leave a review I take ALL factors into consideration. Price service quality of food and truthfulness. Every time I come her I am continually disappointed.<br>Today I got a skinny something turkey bacon sandwich. A glorified slider. I had fries instead of salad. Took over 20 minutes and I was told they were waiting on the fries. I think they were waiting for them to get cold and rubbery. The servers was charming hence the generous 3 stars. Will I ever learn...

How disappointing!  I was expecting spectacular and it stopped way short of it!  I met a couple of other girlfriends for dinner and when the hostess greeted me (kinda)... she looked at me --no smile, no warmth, no welcome--and rather rudely asked...&#34;How many?&#34;  Then when I told her I was meeting another party there and gave the name- she looked to her right, pointed and said &#34;They&#39;re straight down a few tables over.&#34;  Wow, if you&#39;re too lazy to walk the customer to meet their party like the host or hostess should do-then you shouldn&#39;t be working as a hostess:).<br>The server was mediocre at best... No eye contact, just dry and impersonal.  There must&#39;ve been something going around--From the hostess, to the waiter, and it spread to our dinners -because by the time dinner arrived -it was dry and mediocre as well!  I ordered the Eggplant Parmesan and it tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp all night - it was very dry and probably the worst Eggplant Parmesan I&#39;ve ever had!  My girlfriends weren&#39;t all that pleased with their dinners either, but I honestly didn&#39;t taste them so I can only speak for my own.<br><br>***In response to guest services-thank you for acknowledging my less than satisfactory experience!  If it&#39;s useful information, it was a Tuesday night, October 17th @ around 7:30 PM... hopefully you will see this since there&#39;s no way to reply to your response.
Because they allow kids to sit AT THE BAR on a 40 minute wait.  #1 That&#39;s ILLEGAL.  #2 40 minute wait!! On a Friday night on December 16th amid Christmas shoppers.  Sheesh!

We showed up on a weekend just after lunch. The service was ridiculously slow and then the food wasn&#39;t that great, likely because it was overcrowded. In general I love Cheesecake Factories so this was disappointing. My advice is to maybe avoid it when it&#39;s too busy.

Good food and service and awesome cheesecake in a state that is not known for great food.   I mean it&#39;s just a fact... it&#39;s hard to find good food in Colorado (?).   Food in Colorado is overpriced and underwhelming for the most part.  When I&#39;m driven to a &#34;chain&#34; restaurant, a lot has been said.   But, this is about The Cheesecake Factory and they do a good job.  Have eaten at this location a few times and never had a bad meal.  This particular trip included Chicken Madeira, which I would highly recommend, and Spaghetti and Meatballs.  The spaghetti was lacking in sauce, but they were more than glad to bring me more.   The meatballs were very good with a mixture of ground beef and sausage; moist and flavorful.  Cocktails were also well-prepared and generous for the price.  And, of course..... the cheesecake!  You can never go wrong there, other than the calories and carbs, but why go to TCF if you&#39;re not having the cheesecake!?  LOL.  Other perks..... this location is in an upscale mall with easy on/off access to I-25 and direct entry and parking to the restaurant.  They also have a lovely outdoor, covered seating area to enjoy.   Just head for Dillard&#39;s and you&#39;ll see TCF around the corner to the southeast.  Enjoy.

I had heard the food was mediocre so I wasn&#39;t really in a hurry to visit. However, an out-of-town friend wanted the Cheesecake Factory before our jaunt to Ikea, so away we went. Each of us four ordered something different for lunch, and we all were pleased with our selections. (Good thing it was lunch - a dinner bill would have been horrendous.)<br><br>I&#39;d read about the avocado eggrolls, so we tried that as an appetizer. The dipping sauce added a very appealing zip; everyone liked the eggrolls and loved them with the sauce. <br><br>My friend&#39;s eggs Benedict were exactly to her taste. The pasta dish and salmon both were pleasing. My pit beef sandwich was delicious, as were the accompanying fries. Everyone had cheesecake for dessert, of course. While I usually prefer to stick to the plainer cheesecakes, I really enjoyed the Red Velvet version. <br><br>All in all, a very satisfactory lunch. The wait to be seated was ridiculous, however. We had a buzzer, but other people were getting in ahead of us just by standing at the hostess&#39;s stand. We had to push a bit to get seated, and we did complain about the lack of organization in having two different seating systems in use at the same time. The waitress&#39;s attentiveness and excellent service got us into a better mood, fortunately!

Stopped by earlier our server was great he was very attentive and friendly we waited like 20 minutes to be seated not bad they were very busy.I ordered the Cajun pasta and it was good overall we enjoyed our dinner and will be returning.

Service here absolutely sucks. Let me be clear - I love the Cheesecake Factory. I have loved it for many years since the first time I tasted the Orange Chicken. It was the first place I have ever had cheesecake. This location has really started to go down hill in terms of service. <br><br>I ordered tea (hot tea) from our waitress, Monica L, and didn&#39;t get it until I asked for it - three times. The third time I asked a different waitress who brought me iced tea in or minute from my request (one minute) - she tried and I greatly appreciated her quick response to my request. So why did it take my waitress so long? Was it because she was bringing martinis to the people next to us who asked twice? Was it because she kept disappearing for extended periods of time?  I received my tea give minutes after I got my food. Unacceptable. I have had it with the slow service and bad waitresses it is ALWAYS HIT OR MISS. Never consistent - service should be consistent.<br><br>Go to the Boulder or Downtown location. Cheesecake Factory management - do something about this location before they ruin your reputation. Your food isn&#39;t good enough for bad service.  No one pays to be ignored and treated badly. NO ONE!! You get two stars because the Cuban sandwich was outstanding....

I alway have a great experience when I go to the Cheesecake Factory at the Park Meadows mall. The service is great and the food is always consistently yummy, I recommend the Chicken Madeira which is a great twist on a chicken in Marsala-Iike wine sauce, mushrooms, with red bliss mashed potatoes and asparagus. The cheesecakes are obviously always amazing! I love the classic strawberry, dulce de leche, oreo, or banana cheesecakes!

I love this location! However, our last visit was not so pleasant. Our server (Rob) was great he maintained an evenly paced dining experience and didn&#39;t let on that the restaurant was super busy. Our issue was the host and wait. We agreed to the original wait time of 40 minutes. However, after being told a few tables needed to be cleaned and we&#39;d need to wait 15 more minutes. After 5 minutes our buzzer rang. Awesome, except we waited an additional 15 minutes and watched other tables get sat even though we had been called and were told our table was getting cleaned, if it wasn&#39;t for our server I&#39;d be giving this experience a 0!

Cockroach Factory? We just ate here and the food is generally very good HOWEVER, as we were waiting for our check, we were visited at our table by a passing cockroach. Dead seriously, I asked my wife &#34;what is that?&#34; She responded &#34;what you think it is&#34;. We warned the folks seated behind us as the roach crawled past their kid&#39;s head along the wall. I notified the server and the apologetic manager HOWEVER, we are done here. Tableside Roaches!

Got a gift certificate on Christmas and took my Husband out for lunch and we were blown away! Super Quick seating by really friendly people and the decor is amazing, not a bad seat in the whole place! Evan B. Was our waiter and his service was outstanding. He was super knowledgeable, helpful, quick and on top of everything. The price is very reasonable for the massive amounts of food served. We got 1 appetizer and we both took 80% of lunch portions home to enjoy later, which was just as delicious reheated! We will definitely be back soon!

By far the worst experience at a CCF :( Food came out cold and tasted terrible. The pasta davinci is my favorite dish and it was pretty much inedible. We were starving after a very long trip from Co Springs to DIA and heading back to Co Springs. We never seen our waitress again to even get the chance to complain so we just sucked it up and ate what we could. With the super long wait for our table, then incredibly long wait for our food, it was such a terrible experience:(

This place is definitely poorly managed. We had to wait over an hour for our food ( food ordered at 2:30 PM). The waitress didn&#39;t even bother to check on us during our wait either. Basic things like silverware and bread were not available. The manager was busy bussing tables (plenty of bus people around) instead of talking to guests about their wait.  Be cautious of this place until management is changed.

My first Cheesecake Factory experience wasn&#39;t bad, but failed to blow me out of the water. <br>The atmosphere was nice, but very crowded and LOUD. We only waited about 5 minutes for a table inside (they also offer outside seating) and our service was friendly and as quick as expected for how busy it was. <br><br>I ordered a Caribbean Cooler to drink and the spicy crispy chicken sandwich. I have to be honest, the drink was bland. I&#39;m not into super sugary things but this thing could have used a sweeten up. It was reminiscent of sipping slushy coconut water. The spicy crispy chicken was very dark - borderline burnt. It was edible, but I&#39;ve had a better sandwich from Wendy&#39;s. <br>On the up side, we shared fried zucchini for an appetizer and it was fantastic! The zucchini was fresh and flavored to perfection. My counterpart got the steak Diane, which I snuck a bite of, and it was excellent.<br><br>I might be back...maybe a different location.

Parking at this mall is insane. Drove around for 10 minutes and finally parked in a spot that was so squished because of the two ridiculous parkers that ruined the middle spot... thats why we were able to park in this spot. Otherwise we would be driving for another 10 minutes!<br><br>Showed up at the Cheesecake Factory at 1:10pm on a Saturday with a group of 4. We were told the wait is 1 hour. The quotes time was perfect. We got our seats around 2:15pm. The hostess said they are always like this on Saturdays. I will try to avoid this place on weekends! <br><br>The food was as expected. Delicious. They do a great job even with such an immense menu. I was happy to see the GF symbol for gluten free options. <br><br>We got teas, coffee, club soda for beverages. We go the Chicken Samoa for our appetizer. For lunch we had bacon bacon burgers, kale and quinoa salad and the asain salad. For dessert we got raspberry white chocolate cheesecake, Godiva cheesecake and turtle cheesecake. EVERYTHING was so good!<br><br>Our server was fun and attentative.  She was wonderful! We even stayed a little longer after our meal because we were having such a nice time and she didn&#39;t rush us out.<br><br>Overall, parking is terrible. The wait time is long, especially during busy meal times and weekends. The food is great. The menu is huge - something for everyone. Service was top notch.

Visited Saturday afternoon waiting for table. Ladies restroom FILTHY &amp; trashed out. There were several diapers on floor as well. Unbelievable dirt! <br><br>So if their kitchen was this bad, how can food be safely handled! <br>We left &amp; found another restaurant close by.

They ruined our New Year&#39;s Eve dinner. We don&#39;t get out often, but we decided to go shopping and have dinner together. We love the Cheesecake Factory, so we went in and were seated fairly quickly. Another couple was seated a few minutes after us. Our waiter took our drink and appetizer orders, and then took the orders of the couple next to us. We received our mostly-cold avocado egg rolls and ordered dinner. The couple next to us ordered dinner as well. Flash forward to an hour later, as the other couple is finishing dinner and we have yet to receive our dinners.  The other couple was apologizing to us about the service that we were receiving. The manager came out to apologize about the delay and assured us that our dinner would be finished shortly. Over 15 minutes later, our dinners were brought out and were cold and awful. We declined to eat them and left hungry and sad. Oh...and they charged us for the avocado egg rolls and our sodas. Poor, poor choice in their part. We will not return. Terrible customer service, with no apology at the end. What a way to spend a holiday date night. If I could give this place negative stars, I would.

Have you ever tried to have a conversation with a wall? Yeah, neither have I, but I think I know what that feels like after eating here.<br><br>Our server was incredibly slow &amp; needed several reminders to bring our requested drinks &amp; even the straws. When she was taking my mom&#39;s order, she kept shouting &#34;WHAT?&#34; &amp; claimed that she was hard of hearing in one ear... Which is fine, but in that case, she should have known better than to not double check our orders.<br><br>I ordered the Vegan Cobb salad. It took a long time for the food to come out, so when it finally did I dug in hungrily. A few bites later, I tasted... cheese. Clearly, this salad was not vegan. When I let the server know the mistake, she responded with an impressive amount of sass, &#34;I only heard &#39;Cobb,&#39; honey.&#34;<br><br>When I finally got my vegan salad, it came drenched with dressing (I had requested dressing on the side to avoid this). By then, my party was almost done with their food, so I just sucked it up and ate it. Not very happily, mind you. As if that wasn&#39;t enough...<br><br>When we were paying the bill, another waiter helped us. He brought back the change and said, &#34;I didn&#39;t bring the 17 cents; I&#39;m just going to tack it on as tip.&#34; Uh...  Is that even ALLOWED? Sure we&#39;ll gladly tip an extra 17 cents, but it&#39;s about the principle here, people! My friend, out of the wonderful kindness in his heart still left a generous tip.<br><br>I am still giving the place 1 star, because 1) It&#39;s not an option to give zero. And 2) the food itself was actually pretty good. I would recommend the vegan Cobb salad if you&#39;re about that life. The buffalo chicken strips &amp; crab artichoke dip were also good. Would NOT recommend the hibachi steak. I tasted my sister&#39;s, and I swear they marinated that thing in a tub of salt for half a decade. She drank a gallon of water after her meal.<br><br>Would definitely have had a better experience here if we got better service. Or if our server had better hearing.

Terrible restaurant!!!  Good food but extremely poorly managed!!!!  1 hour+ waits and they do not take reservations on Saturdays.  Instead they force people to stand around and wait forever for a table.  You&#39;d think they&#39;d get smart, take reservations, remain as full as they are now and as a big plus people wouldn&#39;t have to wait!!!  What a novel idea!!!  But instead they are a bunch of morons who don&#39;t know how to serve the public.  I&#39;d go elsewhere unanimously if it weren&#39;t for one person in our party who insisted on this loathsome place for a special occasion. Management needs to consider their patrons time and take reservations instead of this madhouse raving lunatic approach...

We had Kevin as our server tonight. He took excellent care of us and as an indecisive person he helped me order a delicious entree followed by the Mango Key Lime cheesecake and Hazelnut cheesecake. Both were awesome. Thank you for the great experience Kevin.

I  believe that one bad person in the staff can ruin the restaurant. I have never had problem with the service at other places before. When we went in, the place was busy. The hostess was in a foul mood and was angrily responding to us. I am hoping that she isn&#39;t racist although I noticed that everyone was seated but us, Asian and the other family who are indian. When I asked why we didn&#39;t get seated, she brushed off and said we are next.  If I am the owner of the restaurant, I will prob fire her for sure. She needs to understand that we, clients, contribute to her salary. We left the premises and ate at the nearby restaurant.
Always very good food!  I love love love the bang bang shrimp!!!  Wait staff is always friendly and attentive.   Highly recommend

Went here Sunday afternoon for my daughter&#39;s birthday because this is where she really wanted to go. We arrived and there was a short wait for a table..that&#39;s fine. We were seated after waiting about 20 minutes later. So far, so good, that was within the time frame quoted. We sat down and there&#39;s where it went downhill. We sat for 10 minutes before we were approached by anyone. We ordered our drinks and informed the server we were ready to order. He said he needed to take other tables drink orders first and would be back. Weird..but okay. Another 10 minutes passes, water and bread arrive, but not our drinks we ordered. A few minutes we got our drinks and placed our food order. We decided to time the food order. We watched as the table across from us, who had arrived after us, started receiving food, ours can&#39;t be far behind, right? Oh, how wrong we were! 55 minutes: that&#39;s how long our food took after ordering. We wanted cheesecake (it is the cheesecake after all!) but we were afraid how long that might take. So we paid our bill and decided to order our cheesecake to go at the counter. That was a mistake too. It really shouldn&#39;t take 20 minutes to take a slice out of the display case, put it in a container and give it to me..but it did. Three hours after entering the restaurant, we were leaving with our dessert in a bag...lunch shouldn&#39;t take that long! Oh, and never once did the server apologize for the delay or attempt to explain it.

My wife and I stopped by for a quick appetizer and drink. Very frustrated by the stadium priced domestic beers and horrible tasting nachos. Salsa is so sweet I might as well had ketchup on them. The cheese was liquid cheese wiz on the bottom and chicken was so finely chopped that is was not satisfying. Very poor value and won&#39;t return.

Today must have just been a bad day I know that they are busy here at this location however I literally got lettuce tacos with half a piece of lettuce I was literally scooping my toppings on to my place which I had to eat with a fork I told the girl that brought the food to me and she said that&#39;s how the letters come sometimes I cannot believe it my cheese casadia I wanted Betty they brought it with chicken however there was nobody to tell everybody was too busy nobody checked on this the entire visit

ALWAYS tasty. ALWAYS impressive. ALWAYS a good time. ALWAYS great ambiance. Even though it&#39;s so cliche, it&#39;s still ALWAYS LIKE WHOA ;)<br><br>- Pretzel Crusted Chicken<br>- Chocolate Mousse Cheesecake
We always get great service when we come here food has always been great love there pasta and shrimp dish along with there everything pizza

Came here on my birthday and the service was slow even though it wasn&#39;t that busy. Came again today and the service was fine, but the chicken salad sandwich wasn&#39;t so I sent it back. Got the bbq chicken salad which was just okay. Overall, this chain used to be one of my faves but lately or at this location it&#39;s subpar.

My family enjoys coming here for special occasions or just trips to the mall. We always have friendly service and of course can&#39;t visit without the delicious cheesecake to take home! The cheesecake never disappoints!

I&#39;ve been here multiple times and I&#39;m always greeted with a warm smile and have an excellent service. The food is great, but the reasons why I&#39;m giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 stars are: 1. waiting time (My family and I had to wait one hour); 2. there is no price for the drink menu which is really shady because I get surprised by the bill every time. I guess I can wait while shopping but having to wait every time sucks. My favorites from this place are: avocado roll with sweet dipping sauce, Da Vinci Pasta, Steak Diane, Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp (although the shrimp portion is TINY).

If you can work your way thru the humongous menu, I&#39;ve yet to have a bad appetizer, entree or (yup) dessert! The avocado egg rolls with tamarind sauce was delish. The daily special, Chicken Riesling (boneless breast in a light creamy sauce with garlic and mushrooms), was excellent over angel hair.

Lauren was our server and she was amazing! She was extremely accommodating, had great food suggestions and a great sense of humor. The food was good but the service is really what made it a great experience.  Thank you Lauren!
I like this place.  The lunch specials are great and not as big.  Chicken piccata was delicious. Chicken Romano also great.  Asian salad excellent.

Today, I was dining at Cheesecake Factory in Park Meadows for Mother&#39;s Day, after a 1.5 hour wait. The wait is fine, as I understand it&#39;s Mothers Day. Dinner went fine as well, even though food took quite some time. Again, I understand it was a busy day. Where things went downhill is when I called Cheesecake Factory later on because I left a shopping bag behind. I know it was at the booth where I was seated and it may have fallen. The girl who picked up at the front desk, first, was very hesitant to even look. Then she told me she went and looked and found nothing. I asked if I can give my receipt so she can know where I was sitting. She said she already looked and found nothing...and HUNG UP! SHE DELIBERATELY HUNG UP ON ME! How disappointing to receive this kind of customer service from the Cheesecake staff. I called back and spoke to a manager. However, I WILL NEVER be dining with Cheesecake again. Cheesecake has no customer value and poor staff training. I wish I didn&#39;t go in today, but I know for sure I will NEVER be going back! Waste of my money and time. I will tell my family and friends of this experience and advise of an alternate to Cheesecake. This chain has gone downhill! How disappointing...as I have been going to Cheesecake with family and friends for YEARS. Thank you!

I won a $50 gift certificate, so I took my mom - I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in over 10 years.   Not much has changed - they&#39;ve got a massive menu and a big selection of specialty cheesecakes.  <br><br>We had no wait to be seated for our Saturday lunch.  Our server was nice but a bit impatient - she checked in with us several times while we were perusing the menu until we explicitly told her it was going to take us at least 10 minutes to read through it all.  <br><br>I ordered a parmesian chicken on a basil and olive oil pasta topped with prosciutto and arugula salad.  It was a bit greasy but so, so good and the portion was HUGE - I ate my leftovers for two days!  The strawberry lemonade was also very good - a perfect mix of sweet and tart - and the refill was included.  I ordered 2 cheesecakes to go - one for me and one for my partner.  Mine was a lemon cheesecake with raspberry soaked lady-finger crust, and though the portion was small for the $6 price tag, it was so rich that this too lasted me several days.  My partner got a tiramisu flavored cheesecake that was downed within 2 minutes of being handed to him (hey Mikey, I think he likes it!).  <br><br>I really enjoyed the food at Cheesecake factory and would definitely go back for a special occasion.  While the prices are a bit steep (around $20 per entree), when it lasts for days, it&#39;s actually a great value.

We have been in the past and it was very good.  We went this past Sunday 1/28 and it was packed as usual.  But, they told us it would be about a 20-minute wait and that turned into a 50-minute wait.  My daughter had the Spaghetti and Meatballs, which she said was good.  But my Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta was just okay.  It was just kind of an odd mix with a few peas and pieces of asparagus thrown in and some kind of crunchy shredded tortilla chips on top.  The flavor of the sauce was very blah and strange.  I make much tastier food at home, so I&#39;m not sure it&#39;s worth it to go and wait all that time for a meal especially when it wasn&#39;t as good as I expected it to be.

It&#39;s a chain. It does what it does exceptionally well, but there is nothing life-changing or earth-shattering here. Just very good chain food very well prepared served by top notch chain servers. If we were comparing them to other chains, I&#39;d give them a 5, but yelpers aren&#39;t here looking for chain food.<br><br>That said, after reading some of the reviews here we hesitated to visit at all. We are new to the area and crave their cheesecake on occasion. We were moving during my son&#39;s 20th birthday last month and a little celebration was overdue, so we went. I can&#39;t speak to the experiences of others, I can only say I&#39;ve eaten at multiple locations in two handfuls of states, and it&#39;s probably one of the top two I&#39;ve been to. The service was impeccable on our visit, and the food was just as delicious as always. <br><br>I think the only &#34;blooper&#34; was the very sweet young hostess telling myself and my son to &#34;have a nice day, ladies!&#34; as we were leaving. In all fairness, he has long, wavy blond hair and his back was towards her, and she didn&#39;t get to stop for two seconds the whole time we were there. But being Lone Tree, some might be offended rather than amused as we were. Let&#39;s hope I&#39;m wrong, but I&#39;ve lived in similar places and watched blowhards demand someone be fired for less, so I hope you&#39;ll forgive my cynicism.<br><br>Our server was absolutely wonderful, I enjoyed the meal, we took some home some cheesecake. It was a nice afternoon, and gratefully appreciated after a long December spent schlepping boxes. <br><br>I expect that any negative reviews represent outliers, this is one of the better run locations (and Cheesecake Factory is already one of the better chains in terms of reliability and excellent service). If you aren&#39;t up for a wait or want to be sure you don&#39;t run to any issues, visit on their slower times and you&#39;ll get abundant attention and speedier seating and service. Otherwise, just go with the flow, it&#39;s still worth it, even during the busy times.<br><br>Also, cheesecake.
Excellent service, food, decoration.....<br>Totally happy with them. Definitely recommend to everybody go there .<br>You won&#39;t be disappointed.

This place takes no reservations and then has a 50 min wait.  The ladies at the front desk are rude and talked for 6 mins before even acknowledging me standing at the desk.<br><br>It&#39;s been an hour and my drink is empty,  my meal isn&#39;t here.  I have seen the waitress twice.  So far this place is a total joke.  I will update after the meal.   Ohh and i had to ask for bread also.
Always a solid stuffed experience.....and the food is always good....My foreign visitors are always blown away by the portion sizes in America, and this certainly takes portion sizes to new heights!!

Wow honestly I was rather disappointed with the service. First when we came in to put our name on the waiting list, the hostess wasn&#39;t very friendly at all. Besides that when we finally got a table, we were not greeted by a waitress till about 10 minutes in and we didn&#39;t even get our waters till then. The food took forever to come out, most of my friends just ordered cheesecake, but a couple of us actually ordered food. It took about 45-1 hour to come out. And the lady who brought out our food said the calamari would come out in 2 minutes, 15 minutes later we had to remind our waitress who forgot. The food was pretty good. And the strawberry shortcake was very good. But it just took forever and people were not too friendly, I probably won&#39;t ever return to this location.

Pretty much everything you would expect. Long waits (tables, orders, etc) made up for with monumental servings. Prices are good, but that wait kills two stars.<br><br>Service at this location is, once again, par for the course. Nothing mind-blowing, nor offensive. Frankly, unless your goal is to have leftovers, i would suggest another restruant in the Park Meadows mall area. Cajun Grill, anyone?

Ambiance - Excellent decor and ambiance<br>Service - Excellent service, I ordered a beer and it wasn&#39;t chilled enough, it was swiftly replaced.<br>Food - Buffalo blasts was delicious, highly recommended. Pizza was nice too.<br>Drinks - Not that extensive menu

Ate lunch today on the patio at park meadows. There were pigeons above us on the rafters. Had to clean off my seat from pigeon poop. While we were eating pigeon pooped on the floor beside us. Asked waitress why they don&#39;t take care of this she said it&#39;s the management company. They won&#39;t take care of it. Called management company they informed me it is not their responsibility as it&#39;s part of the cheesecake factories lease to clean up the mess. I think this is a health hazard and should be dealt with immediately.  Don&#39;t eat on the patio

I wish I could get buffalo blasts other places. I came here today and sat and waited 15 minutes for a table, which I understand (even though I was told it would be a matter of minutes). We order as soon as we sit, and an hour later our food is still not here. All we ordered was buffalo blasts and a caesar salad. This place is a joke.

Cheesecake Factory suffers from ho-hum service now. In earlier years, my server would take great care to see that my food arrived as ordered and ensured all my needs were attended to. Tonight, the server delivering our appetizer wasn&#39;t sure he had the right table and was unaware of what we ordered. My Orange Chicken main course was just okay. Again, the server wasn&#39;t sure he had the correct table or the proper order. My server checked in with me from a distance, answering their own question and moving onto bigger and better things. I would have liked soy sauce to accompany my meal, but no one seemed to care or ask me. My advice, skip the meal and just order cheesecake to go. I&#39;m no longer going to drive up here from the Springs for a meal and cheesecake. Another one bites the dust.

The Waite time is the worst I would give them 5 stars if they told the truth about Wait time and if we had a good server our food is  always good  but they obviously are so busy they dot care about Loyal customers

I would give it no stars if it was possible. Wait time was extremely long for two people however I understand it&#39;s a Friday night. Ordered our food and it took almost 40 minutes to get to the table. When it arrived I got completely the wrong dish . The food runner then proceeded to tell me if I send it back it would take another 15-20 Minutes I said I am not willing to wait see what you can do to fix it . The manager brings it out and its still not correct . And when the bill came they charged me for the incorrect item I told them I can&#39;t even believe your now going to charge me for the wrong item . The waitress Amanda did not even apologize nor did the manager and did not even acknowledge they screwed it up. I will never go back to this establishment ever. Worse customer service I have ever experienced .

They made us wait about an hour to get a table even though they had several empty tables just waiting to be cleaned. It was at least an hour and a half before we got our food. The service was horrible with the rudest server I&#39;ve ever seen at cheesecake. We didn&#39;t get our drinks refilled and he wouldn&#39;t bother to give us straws.  The food was tasteless and my chicken marsala had about five pieces of mushrooms on top of it.
Sticky table. Dirty utensils - took waaay too long to bring out a burned pizza. Over it.

It is like most cheesecake factory locations!<br>We tried the avocado eggrolls, and WOW, it was like a party in my mouth! I would have just had them as my main course!<br>Their food was delicious as usual!<br>And ofcourse, we had the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut cheesecake and again WOW! <br>We definitely over stuffed ourselves, but it was all delicious till the end.

Huge menu and good cheesecake. Unfortunately, it has become another over commercialized chain. Yes it&#39;s better than most. However, it has succumbed to mediocrity. I know in its infancy it was a really good restaurant. It has become a victim of its own success, as far as food goes. <br><br>Naturally, in places such as this the staff is good. They are held accountable for their service and this they are responsive. It&#39;s a convenience spot for us now.

A good place to eat and what seems to be a professional staff. Nice abiance but a smaller place as it&#39;s in Park Meadows mall. The hostess told us there was a 20 minute wait... turned out to be more like 45. I understand that its a popular place, but everyone before and after us was also told 20 minutes as well and there were plenty of grumbles in the queue.<br><br>It would be nice to be told a slightly more accurate time. A popular place should have a more accurate feel for time.<br><br>Took a bit of time, about 8 minutes to see our waiter. We ordered drinks. Very good. We ordered an appetizer. Fried cheese... only to be told they were out. Sigh. Had the potato tots. Pretty good.<br><br>Had the Chicken ballagio and a chicken Ceasar salad. All good.<br><br>Waiter then offered us a cheesecake menu and mentioned the scrumptious peppermint bark cheesecake. Ordered the chocolate mouse and the bark... you guessed it... out of the bark.<br><br>By the way, I wrote this all, and edited it... after we ordered our single slice of cheesecake (to go) and it still hasn&#39;t arrived.<br><br>A good place to visit, just not sure we&#39;ll come back to this one. Perhaps we&#39;ll try after the holidays since it seems they may not be able to hendle the rush, but maybe not.
The Cheesecake Factory is one of our favorite restaurants. Our go to is the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta which never disappoints.

Cheesecake Factory is a great family meal place for many occasions. The menu is literally a book with meal options for all different types. So many choices you can&#39;t go wrong !!! The food is excellent !! Portions are huge !! Yet the service is very slow ! It will take a good amount of time to get your food . Defiantly recommend as a fun place to eat though !

Portions are HUGE, so if you can, order lunch size portions or from the Skinnylicious menu.  The latter has meals under 600 calories (perfect for that after dinner dessert).  This place is always busy so plan on at least a 20min wait.  Regardless, the service is top notch.  It is a great place to catch up with friends and have conversation without fighting with musak to be heard.   Not a fan of cheesecake so I go for the Lemoncello cake.  It totally rocks!

Always a nice spot to splurge on.   Food fabulous, desserts also the Bomb. Service tonight was only so, so. Not busy compared to other visits but rarely saw server. Never got tea refilled or bread basket. That I guess is ok due to what was ordered for 2 people.   Starter was Chicken Sliders. Could be eaten as meal. Entree&#39;s were Chicken n Bisquits and traditional Spaghetti and Meatballs.  Both looked awesome. Would have added photo but companion mixed up the plate so last it&#39;s picturesque presentation. Taste was great. Had plenty to take home. Dessert was 4 diff cheesecakes -original, low carb original, salted Carmel and Very, very cherry Giradelli chocolate cheesecake.    More to take home.  Of course I&#39;ll be back.

I&#39;ve been here several times over the past couple of years for various occassions ranging from just dinners to birthdays. I&#39;ve always had an issue with their wait times and how it seems the wait staff is always over-extended like they aren&#39;t staffed enough for the volume of customers.<br><br>The last time I was there, I had an atrocious experience and will never return. After waiting 25 minutes, the hostess called our party and then bolted out the door to go outside. We didn&#39;t want to sit outside but to be fair, we didn&#39;t request indoors. The hostess sat us at a table outside without shade and since the sun was starting to set, the sun was right in our eyes. We needed another chair for our party and she brought back a wet chair. It was wicker so wiping it down didn&#39;t get all the water off. She said sorry it rained and handed me the wet chair to sit on. I sat down and my shorts immediately started to get wet.<br><br>I went inside and asked if we could get a table inside. The other hostess asked what was wrong with the table outside so I mentioned the sun and the chair discomforts. The first hostess who sat us outside, took us to a new table. After she was out of range from the manager and other hostesses, she turned to me and rudely stated that I should not have informed the front of the chair and not wanting to sit outside and that I should have stated it initially instead of being a poor customer and causing trouble. Since it was my friend&#39;s birthday I let it go and didn&#39;t cause a scene.<br><br>The waitress we got was a rock star. She was friendly, courteous, knew the menu and gave us recommendations. The turkey burger is always good and cooked well. I think I&#39;ve ordered it the last three visits. She had the staff sing happy birthday to my friend. Towards the end of the meal, I asked to speak to the manager who came over and I told her about the initial hostess experience. She really didn&#39;t ask for details or seem very concerned.<br><br>I will not return here due to the poor host station customer service. The wait staff is awesome and the food is good especially considering the extensive menu. Props to the chefs and cooks in the back for pumping out high quality food at a reasonable rate. It&#39;s just hard to overcome an experience when the hostess is rude and then fires back when you bring it to their attention.
