It was the only saving grace for this place (which makes sense given the name of the restaurant).<br><br>We came back a second time (hoping we would not get the same server lady as last time) because of the &#34;Buy a gift certificate and get two free slices of cheesecake&#34; promotion. I got a chicken with linguine pasta dish this time around. The food is mediocre, but at least it is consistently mediocre? This time around, we got a really amazing server who was constantly keeping our water filled, packing our leftovers for us, and providing amazing, timely service. All in all, a great experience with amazing cheesecake, but mediocre food again.<br><br>The mediocre food would net three stars, but the amazing cheesecakes pull it up to a four. The terrible service followed by the amazing service leave the rating at a 4.0

Took family for NYE dinner.  Hour wait turned out to be only 40 minutes. but wait for food was incredibly long.  Waiter was apologetic and offered additional bread, soup etc to keep kids settled.  Brought home lots of leftovers since everyone was full when our meal finally came.

This was our first visit the the Cheesecake Factory.  We went late on a weeknight and were seated immediately.  Our male server was excellent.  He made us feel very comfortable, offered suggestions and was always available.  My husband ordered the filet mignon and said it was the best he&#39;d ever had.  I had the herb salmon and it was also delicious.  Loved the salted caramel cheesecake but my husband didn&#39;t care for the &#34;turtle&#34; cheesecake (too chocolatey) not enough caramel and nuts.  Our overall experience was great.  Highly recommend this restaurant to others.

I was super impressed!  We were told it would be a 45 min wait and it was almost exactly.  We were seated and my friends were here from out of town wanting the steak street tacos.  Once opening the menu...they weren&#39;t on it any more!  Only chicken and shrimp.  We told or waitress Lyndsey who went directly to the kitchen to ask.  The chef came out!  On a packed, busy Friday night!  Did you hear me?  He asked her exactly what kind of meat she wanted and he would take care of it.  Are you kidding me?  There are plenty of great things on the menu that they could have easily said they couldn&#39;t do it and made her choose something else, but they didn&#39;t!  They went above and beyond...we were thoroughly impressed.  Our food was all hot and delicious.  Thank you CCF...you made a great night with dinner and friends.  :-)

No reservations accepted on the weekend--be prepared to wait a while if you&#39;re stopping by on a Saturday night (as we did). To pass the time we had drinks and appetizers in the bar area.  I highly recommend the Thai lettuce wraps.  They are fresh, healthy and accompanied with three dipping sauces.  Delish. <br><br>An attentive waitress kept our drinks full and our spirits higduse we waited it out...<br><br>flash forward to dinner...<br><br>Our waiter was memorable (in a good way) but I got the feeling he was serving a few too many tables (not his fault!). It was a busy night so a couple things took longer than preferred (e.g. boxing up leftovers...bringing dessert menus), but he gets an A for effort and personality.  <br><br>The food was really, really good. Monstrous portions, prepared exactly as requested. The Santa Fe salad is always a good choice (I ask for the dressing on the side...it&#39;s rich and addicting!).  My sis LOVED the stuffed chicken tortillas. The grilled corn cakes, melted cheese, and savory chicken unite in flavorful harmony. <br><br>The hardest part of the meal is deciding which kind of cheesecake to order.  With over 30 tasty options you&#39;re bound to run into some indecisiveness. Chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake was sinful, and the original cheesecake was light and fluffy (I personally prefer more density). <br><br>Although lengthy, a very good experience.

The family stopped in for Easter dinner. One of the first times we didn&#39;t have to wait for a table. Our meal was very good, but, 2 of us ordered the chicken and it seemed like it was taking a long time to get to our table. <br><br>The kitchen manager came to our table to apologize for the delay and they would comp those 2 meals. Seems they pre-cook the chicken meals during the day but they ran short that night and that&#39;s what caused the delay.

I have always been overwhelmed by the menu at The Cheesecake Factory. However, I am no longer in this situation due to the discovery of one terrific menu item: Chicken Bellagio. The combination of crispy chicken breast, basil pasta, prosciutto, and arugula salad is genius and the portion size leaves enough for a late night snack or lunch the next day. I&#39;ve converted a few people to this dish and they are satisfied.
like always i love this place , we went there with my brother his wife , we all love this place, everything is fresh, testing good, service is great, i highly recomendate this place!!!!

On Sunday October 18th I spoke to a manager at the Cheesecake Factory by the name of Paul at 12:00 noon.<br>I explained to Paul that I would like to make a reservation for a large party of 18, at which time Paul informed me that they do not take reservations. However he did tell me if I was there at 5:00 pm that my wait time would only be 15 minutes.<br>I arrived at 4:59 walked up and asked to speak with Paul.  Paul was at the hostes station I told him that I had spoke to him about a large party of 18 he looked up to see me and a few of my family member that were with me.  At that point Paul informend me that my wait would now be an hour and a half. Paul proceed to tell me I misunderstood our conversation.  <br>I did not misunderstand our conversation Paul saw a larger group of Hispanic Americans and refused to treat us with respect.  <br>I have never played the race card but in this case it was very clear to me that Paul is a huge RACIST.  What upset me even more was that a party of 15 white americans came in and were sitted while Paul and I were having a heated discussion. <br>If you are Hispanic, Mexican, Spanish or however you like to refer to yourself as in the Latin community I WOULD HAVE TO ASK THAT YOU NOT EAT AT THE PARKMEADOWS CHEESCAKE FACTORY.

Took the wife here on her b-day......also valentine day.  Wait wasn&#39;t too bad for a holiday and Friday evening. Walked around the mall then sat down. Having the ability to shop made the wait nice. I ordered the steak and salmon and a beer, wife ordered the shrimp with a mixed drink. Service was top 10 ever, period. The server was so great, made sure the management knew, they took time on a busy night to hear my compliment. I&#39;m a cheesecake snob, real cheesecake is only made in Europe. The Cheesecake Factory is the closest to the real thing I&#39;ve found in the states in a normal restaurant. We will be back for sure!

The food has really taken a dip at this Cheesecake Factory.  I used to eat here weekly and we stopped because of the bad service, but I came back in because I missed the food. Big mistake.  The portions are smaller which is fine, but the food tastes frozen and old.  I had a chicken sandwich with fries and my wife had a salad.  The salad tasted old and the fries were just terrible.  The cheesecake is still great but the meal was terrible.

I dined in the bar area one night and got takeout another. Service for both visits was fast, friendly and warm. My food was cooked perfectly. This was a familiar spot to wind down the evening while in town on business.

My first time eating here. Pretty classy joint for a restaurant based around cheesecake.<br><br>Waitress was annoying on several levels. Spoke in really strange octaves that were atrocious to my ears. <br><br>Food was good but not worth the enormous prices, HOWEVER, the Calamari appetizer made me gurgle with joy.

Upon arriving for lunch, we were given a pager and told a 20 minute wait. We waited 40 minutes before the pager went off. My husband handed the pager to the hostess and told us to wait off you the side. We waited another 20 minutes while watching party after party be taken back. My husband finally went up to the podium and told the guy what was happening. He said &#34;sorry about that&#34; and we were the next party called. After ordering immediately, we waited another 40 minutes to receive our food. We will not be coming back.

Fun Atmosphere With Fatty Food<br>     If you want to go to a fun place that has yummy food, with huge portions of creamy, greasy, fried, and deliciousness, then go to Cheesecake Factory!  Cheesecake Factory is a casual, American chain restaurant.  It provides large portions of food from an enormous menu.  The reason I like going there so much is because you can pretty much get anything you want.  You can tell the waiter what you want, without even looking at the menu, and they will make it for you.  It&#39;s a comfortable, friendly, and fair place for people that are on a budget and people that are not on the budget.  The quality of the atmosphere, service, and food are the things that make Cheesecake Factory so special.  If I was a restaurant critic, I would have nothing bad to say about Cheesecake Factory.  It is my number one place to go to, because I know that I am going to leave happy and satisfied.  <br>     It is important to have good atmosphere at all the restaurants because it makes you feel safe and entertained.  The atmosphere at Cheesecake is unique.  The building of Cheesecake Factory, inside and out, is well decorated.  It is not run down and not ugly looking.  Everything inside the building is modern.  They have computer systems, a big TV, you can use credit cards, and the chefs read the orders from computers. When you come inside, you automatically feel like it&#39;s going to be a good experience.  It is a warm and inviting place.   The lights are just perfect.  It&#39;s not too bright and not too dark. The colors of the whole place are vibrant. The color of the menu matches the colors on the walls.  The art on the ceilings and the walls allow you to create stories in your head, which is fun. They have a good choice of music.  It&#39;s not annoying or boring; it&#39;s just the right kind of music for everyone to enjoy.  The yummy smell pulls you in and makes you feel like you can already taste the food.  Cheesecake Factory is laid out exceptionally well.  There is plenty of space for walking and plenty of space for different sizes of tables. The part that I love is when you walk in, you see all the desserts they have right in front of you.  It&#39;s exciting because you can start thinking about what you would want for dessert.  Also, the place is super clean.  I&#39;ve never seen anything dirty or gross there.  Cheesecake Factory is a perfect place to go because you can go there with family, friends, coworkers, neighbors, a date, and with pretty much anyone you can think of.  <br>     Having good service makes people happy it&#39;s one of the things that is crucial to have in all restaurants.  The service at Cheesecake Factory is perfect.  The waiters/waitresses are dressed professionally.  Even though there are 21 pages to the menu, they know everything that is on there, which is good because it saves a lot of time.  The waiters/waitresses are pleasant and attentive. They always come and make sure the customers have everything they need and make sure that they like the food they received.  Delicious bread is brought out right away, so if you are super hungry you can snack on the bread before the meal comes.  The food always comes out superfast; you don&#39;t have to starve yourself or wait for it for an hour.  What makes me really feel good when I go to Cheesecake is that anytime there is a flaw in your food the manager always comes out and talks to you.  Even if you say the french fries are too crispy, the manager will come out, apologize, and remake the french fries.  Everyone that works there is extremely polite and always carries a smile on their face, which makes me happier as a customer.  All in all, Cheesecake Factory is amazing in every way, and I would strongly suggest going there, and ordering their delicious cheesecake. <br>     Every time I go to Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;m amazed with the quality of the food.  The food is always so fresh you just want to keep eating and eating.  Their sandwiches are to die for. The juicy, fresh turkey on soft, fluffy bread, crisp tomatoes, crunchy lettuce, soft avocado, and crispy bacon is just heaven.  They have fried foods for those who want it, but they also offer low fat and gluten-free fare for those who would like it.  I realized a long time ago that the portions are humongous, so it&#39;s fun to get a lot of different foods and split them with people. The price is fair at Cheesecake Factory.  It seems like the food is too expensive, but the meal portions are equivalent to the price.  It&#39;s great to go to Cheesecake Factory for your birthday because the food is amazing and the staff members sing happy birthday to you.  I love taking my friends there on their birthdays because they get really embarrassed when the staff sings happy birthday, it&#39;s really fun to watch.  It is fun to eat at Cheesecake Factory because they have fatty, saucy, greasy, naughty foods.

I have always been a fan of The Cheesecake Factory; I&#39;m not sure what it is. In nearly every case, the admirable architecture and ambiance are ruined by the deafening noise of other diners&#39; conversations, and FORGET sitting at the &#34;tables.&#34; I&#39;ve always disliked the half padded bench seat / half chair set-ups - WHAT are they doing in a restaurant that prides itself in being &#34;upscale&#34;, and WHY are they placed so closely together!? The last time I had to sit at one of these tables I felt as though the people to the left and right of us might as well have participated in our conversation. Lord knows that EVERY time I&#39;ve had to get up while sitting at the tables, I&#39;ve been completely embarrassed by the feeling that my butt was going to knock over their wine glass (never has!) <br><br>I&#39;d say the three best features of The Cheesecake Factory are:<br><br>1. The wheat bread. I always ask for fifths! Ha! :P<br>2. The huge portions - I always have left-overs to last a few days.<br>3. THE CHEESECAKE<br><br>What about the food, you ask? I&#39;m a fan of the Farfalle Pasta and tend to stick to salads. I had the BBQ chicken salad for the first time during my last visit and it had to be one of the best salads I have ever had - hands down. The Luau salad is also unique, a tried and true favorite, but I wouldn&#39;t say that the food at TCF is much better than your regular chain restaurant.<br><br>I was bummed that my server didn&#39;t give me the left-over wheat bread I had last time :( She didn&#39;t even ask! Oh well, there is always next time I guess!

I love the luxurious atmosphere, but the place was too dim. The food is generally pretty good. The cheesecake selection is huge. They are very good- I can see why they specialize in them, but they are a little too sweet for my taste. The prices for the entrees are decent, but the drink menus are overpriced in my opinion. The service is good.

I know, it&#39;s a chain. I know, it&#39;s in a mall. It goes against everything I believe in for a restaurant, yet I&#39;m hooked.  Not all cheesecake factories are created equal. My favorite is in Vegas and I have to eat there, every time I go.  This one is a close second.  I&#39;m terrible too, because I order the same thing every time: Evelyn&#39;s pasta and Chocolate raspberry cheesecake.  Both that I love and believe are perfection.  Our service this last week was outstanding- attentive, polite and speedy.  When I forgot to tell our server to hold the whipped cream on the cheesecake, he made a mad dash across the restaurant.  My dad loves their coffee, which is very dark, so be prepared- the server had it filled up at just the right moments for my dad.  The bread- fabulous.  I love the bread. I&#39;ll admit it, when I was younger and poorer, happy hour drinks and this bread made a fantastic meal. <br><br>Portions are huge.  A little pricey, but you get a lot of food.  And the waitstaff- phenomenal.  I&#39;d eat here once a week if it wasn&#39;t so out of my way.  It can also get quite loud in here, with everyone from families and couples and who all in between talking.

pretty busy location since it is attached to a mall. the service was outstanding but the food was just so so. I ordered a cheeseburger and french fries were cold even though I had asked for them to be a cooked extra Crispy. I also think that the menu has too many things kind of like reading a book. the desert is really the reason you would go there after all they are called The Cheesecake Factory. I will definitely return for the cheesecake but probably not eat lunch or dinner

Cheesecake only gets three stars because of their Cheesecake. Don&#39;t even bother going here for dinner. Unless you like restaurants that have such a big menu and diverse array of cuisines that they can&#39;t get one thing right... <br><br>Yes, they have Asian and American, Italian and everything in between. You can have whatever your little heart desires. But its all sub par. They are a CHEESECAKE factory. A factory of desserts. If you want wontons, ravioli, even a hamburger, don&#39;t bother. Go to a real Asian restaurant, or a real Italian restaurant. Flip your own burgers. It&#39;s nothing special, honestly.<br><br>If you&#39;re a tourist and aren&#39;t adventurous enough to try a new restaurant and a new city, then yeah, go to the Cheesecake Factory. You&#39;ll get mediocre food for a dumb price. If you want salads and pasta servings as big as your head, go here too. If you like eating 3,500 calorie meals... definitely go here. <br><br>Maybe this one just sucks? It&#39;s in the mall, that might have something to do with it.<br><br>On another occasion, my friends and I were craving cheesecake on a Saturday night after some time out. It was only 11:30. They close at 12 on weekends. They saw us walking up and came over and LOCKED THE DOORS ON US. Terrible, terrible customer service. When the customer service isn&#39;t awful, the waiters are way too attentive... refilling your drinks when it&#39;s not necessary, being pushy. <br><br>Spare yourselves.

Horrible food and over priced. We ordered the calamari and was mushy, I had to spit it out on a napkin. Then we both got our meals and were highly disappointed. It was just not good at all. My husband found things in his pasta that weren&#39;t even supposed to be part if his meal, which just shows how sloppy they are in the kitchen. Save your money. Go somewhere else.

We had one of the salads, which was pretty good, but very large.   Our server, Sarah Smith (we asked her name because she was awesome) was so energetic and very kind and helpful.  She was all over our drinks, making sure we had refills as needed.   I ordered some modifications to my salad due to food allergies, and it was perfect. I will go back because of her.

Took the family of 5 for Mothers Day.  We had a couple of burgers, pasta dish, spaghetti and lettuce wraps.  Soda&#39;s but no desserts.  With tip the check was $110.  This is just rediculous.  The Chicken Alfredo that my daughter ordered was $20 and it was average at best.  No more we are done paying over the top for average food.

Service was excellent, food was great the only down side to this place is the waiting time. We waited 50 minutes to be seated for dinner on a Saturday night. It is busy but It was worth it. Time can go fast if you&#39;re walking around the mall and doing a little shopping. I had the ribeye steak with garlic mashed potatoes and green beans, everything was cooked to perfection.

Always a great ambiance. The food never let&#39;s me down. This place is so reliable. I love the Chicken Marsala. Sweet corn tamales are my favorite appetizer. Service is hit or miss from time to time but I guess that any restaurant. Our server had a few senior moments and had to be reminded about simple requests. Why 4 stars instead of 5? Ask me.

The Cheesecake Factory is a huge chain and so  you probably either love it or hate it.  In my opinion, the cheesecake is top notch!  This time of year when their pumpkin cheesecake is in season is my favorite time to go.  Their cheesecakes are rich and served in huge slices that will satisfy any sweet tooth.  As for the food, well, it is what it is.  The menu is HUGE (if you haven&#39;t been there it is a spiral bound book!).  That is great for variety, but other than the cheesecake they haven&#39;t perfected anything.  My favorite food there is the BBQ Chicken salad.  Tip: the half portion is as large as any entree salad anywhere else so save some $$ and cut the portion size!  Other than that, service is usually good, the place is usually packed (so expect a wait) and parking is easy (it&#39;s in the mall).

I know this is a chain restaurant but I still love it anyway.  After a day of shopping at Park Meadows there is nothing more satisfying that taking a lunch/early dinner break here.  I know the food will be good (maybe not great- but satisfying)- and the cheesecake of my choice will be awesome.  <br>Obviously there are drawbacks- menu is HUGE (way too many choices), unless you&#39;re in a booth, the seating is very close together so you can hear most peoples&#39; conversation, and it is ALWAYS busy.  But nonetheless I still find this a reasonable priced place that serves consistently good food.  (the portions are huge- I always suggest getting the lunch or half portion-you are still guaranteed to have leftovers) The work staff at this location has always been courteous and fun and then décor is pleasant. <br>Last but not least the cheesecake- if you&#39;re not a fan this is not the place for you.  Having more than 30 different kinds- it&#39;s amazing.  The special Red Velvet is perfect- no overwhelmingly sweet just a bit of heaven.  My FAVORITE is the Tuxedo cheesecake- a perfect melding of Chocolate Cheesecake and vanilla Mascarpone Mousse is mouth watering.  <br>Oh and if you get the chance try the fried macaroni and cheese- maybe the best thing ever to come out of this place!

Ordered dry chicken tacos with dry rice and a slop of beans.  Jeez, this was bad.  We got there as soon as they opened. Went to the airport today and decided to take our friend to the cheesecake factory.  Other times, the food was good.  Don&#39;t know what happened at this Cheesecake Factory.

I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factories around the country many times and there is something to be said for consistent good food.<br><br>Personally I like to review restaurants based on what they are, is this a high end restaurant with a celebrity chef? No it isn&#39;t, so I&#39;m not going to rate it based on that criteria. What it IS is a reasonably priced premium CHAIN. Based on that, I would say Cheesecake Factory is a great experience and a good value.<br><br>The service is consistently good, the food is delicious and the ambiance is nice. <br><br>Some of my favorites are:<br><br>1. Chicken Bellagio<br>2. Tomato Basil Pasta<br>3. Grilled Chicken Medallions<br>4. Meatloaf<br><br>For Deserts try:<br><br>1. Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake<br>2. 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cheesecake<br>3. Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple<br><br>If you&#39;re looking for a consistently good meal and service, I would say you&#39;re safe with CF.

Cheesecake factory has yet to disappoint me. Our server (I wish I had gotten her name) was beyond fantastic. For food we had the avocado egg roll appetizer (these things are the BOMB), for entrees my husband had the chicken...something, that I can&#39;t remember the name of, but he said it was delicious. I ALWAYS get the farfalle with garlic, it&#39;s my standby and I love it every time. Cheesecake a plus, the atmosphere was just fine, and like I said, service was a 10 last night.

I have been here several times, it&#39;s always a pleasant experience. They have a huge menu, and usually that scares me. However, everything I&#39;ve tried tastes great! I just tried the chicken stuffed tortillas, it was amazing!
Horrible discourteous service.  Waiter had dirty hands and was mean.  Never will go again to this establishment.

Great service, reasonable wait time, food is way more than you need. Our server Jeremy was fantastic. He treated my son like a prince. We will be back to see Jeremy and to have more white chocolate cheesecake.

OK, I admit, I&#39;m biased.. call it full disclosure or call it just fandom, but I&#39;m a huge TCF fan (The Cheesecake Factory).  I&#39;ve been a huge fan since the early 1990s, when I first tried it in Beverly Hills, CA.<br><br>I do own the stock (ticker = CAKE, how cool is that!?) and blog about all the ones I&#39;ve been (count is now 15) - <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.saitz.com%2FCategoryView%2Ccategory%2CCheesecake.aspx&amp;s=9e76734ab768132e66979bf66d79faf1f08464590ea8973f5cffd060aec44d0f" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">saitz.com/CategoryView,c…</a><br><br>But once you get past my personal love of this place, it&#39;s hard to dispute that it&#39;s a great eatery.  The selection is as extensive as you could find, the portions are big (but many items available in 1/2 portions around lunch), the drinks are excellent, and yes, the dessert is something special.<br><br>I don&#39;t even go just for the cheesecake!  I and my family love the menu: the salads, the appetizers, the delicious passion fruit iced tea, and my personal favorite, thai chicken pasta!<br><br>The service is generally very good and for a chain, this is one of the better run ones. <br><br>They don&#39;t do reservations and are often full, so you may need to take a pager and wait.  My tip is to go an early lunch and beat the crowd.

Came tonight to celebrate my son&#39;s first birthday, but mostly an excuse for the adults in his life to get together. I called earlier in the day to make a reservation for 10, but they told me they wouldn&#39;t take reservations after 5:30 pm, I needed one for 6:30 so I guess we had no choice, but to walk in. At 6:30 we arrived with half our party, the rest running a few minutes late. They said our table is ready, but we weren&#39;t allowed to sit down until everyone arrived. Frustrating because I am holding a 29 lb baby in my arms. A few minutes later, the rest of our party arrive and we go to tell the concierge we are ready and they tell us now we have to wait 15 minutes. Finally, we get seated and they don&#39;t bring a high chair nor a kids menu even though they asked us if we needed on right before we sat down. Luckily our waiter, was the only good part about the experience. He was quick to get us a high chair, kids menu and was very friendly. We order and it takes AN HOUR to receive our food. Then when we receive our food, they are delivered one at a time spanning a total of 10 minutes to serve us all. My husband&#39;s food and son&#39;s meal were supposed to have fries, but we had to wait another 5 minutes to receive them. The food was ok, nothing great. When all was said and done it took us 2.5 hours to eat dinner.

We came here for a co-worker&#39;s celebratory lunch.  There were 8 or 9 of us I think.  We called ahead for a reservation, but they weren&#39;t ready to seat us.  In fact it took another 10 minutes or so standing in the entrance area.  Once we were seated, our waitress was helpful and pretty quick with drink orders.  It took another few minutes to get the food order taken.  Then, it seemed like we waited an eternity for the food to arrive.  Super slow kitchen.  I had the Baja chicken tacos and they were pretty bland.  I suggest not ordering them.  They had so little taste.  I was really really disappointed.  The check was split up between everyone, but with large parties they put a guaranteed 15% tip added in.  That has got to be the biggest pain in my butt ever.  I never tip less than 20%.  I totally get the reasoning behind it, but I hate having to recalculate an already calculated tip then add it all together. <br><br>For what I paid, I got slow service from a good waitress, a really sub-par meal, and an annoying check to recalc.  If I&#39;m taking any clients out or thinking about finding a place to eat myself, I won&#39;t even consider Cheesecake Factory from this point on.  Sub-par on almost every level.

so the cheesecake alone is worth the 4 stars, but the food really is good. <br><br>i&#39;m a fan of the lunch portion menu - which is still way more than enough food. the santa fe chicken salad is ridiculous and my usual go-to menu item. this last visit i had the chicken picatta. it was good. not mind blowingly excellent, but good.

Came here again for lunch.  Same story, thank goodness, but alas, we have cheesecake this time!<br><br>Cuban sandwich: 5/5.  Again<br>Navajo sandwich: 4/5.  The fried bread was so deliciously lard-y &amp; crunchy, omg still thinking about it.  This would have gotten 5 stars IF they had added some sort of distinguishable spread, like a spicy, chipotle, garlic mayo.. Something rather than plain mayo.  It needed a kick, otherwise, finger-licking good<br><br>French fries: 4.5  So crispy on the outside &amp; nice and potato-y on the inside, just like I like it.<br><br>Oh yah &amp; the starter salads? 4/5. We asked for broccoli to be added and we were hooked up. The balsamic vinegarette was also perfectly balanced.<br><br>And now, for the grand finale...<br><br>Red velvet cheescake: 4.5/5  Moist, creamy, not overly sweetened, delicately whipped..<br><br>Kahlua cheesecake 4/5.  See above + coffee flavored graham cracker crust...<br><br>*drool
Amazing service and food. Very clean establishment and friendly staff. Great outdoor seating area for nice days. Highly recommend this place! Will be returning!

Consider my lesson learned. When a restaurant has a name like &#34;Cheesecake Factory,&#34; the specialty is... cheesecake. Not food. I&#39;m still trying to figure out what the point of a twenty-three page long (and still growing) menu is.... Hmm....<br><br>I will give them this, though, the fried macaroni balls with marinara was pretty darned outta sight. And their cocktails were good. But really, outside of our appetizers, drinks, and dessert, dinner was a pretty sad affair. I went out as a group of 5 (perfect number for the appetizer... we each got our own ball thing), and we all got different entrees. I have a bad habit of stealing bites from other people&#39;s plates (No, not strangers. The people I came with. I give them bites too. It&#39;s more fair that way, and if I get something really fabulous, you know they&#39;ll be stealing bites of my dinner right back.)<br><br>Anyway... I stole bites of 4 entrees, and had my own (wasabi-crusted Ahi tuna, which sounded delish. No.) entree, and I was very sad after my tasting spree... I think we all had leftovers and no one wanted a box, because the food was sad.<br><br>To balance out the rather depressing and pitiful whimper that dinner was, the cheesecake was freakin fantastic. Not like mom makes (or like I make, for that matter) but considering I didn&#39;t have to go through all the effort to make a cheesecake for a really good cheesecake, they recovered themselves there. Basically, go to Cheesecake Factory for dessert if you&#39;re in this area and can&#39;t find an open patisserie shop. Otherwise, skip it, you won&#39;t be missing anything.

Oh boy what an epic fail. We got seated around 5:50ish and didn&#39;t get our food until 7:00ish. Just two kids meals and a pasta dish for myself. They must have had some people not come in the kitchen. They did apologize and the manager came up to explain things were running behind. I understood but after all that time they failed on the chicken piccata. Not sure what it was but it was advertised with capers and zero capers and  nasty. Chicken said it was a sautéed chicken um NO. Looks like boiled chicken and had a horrible flavor. I sent it back and they brought me spaghetti and meatballs. A little better but noodles still tasted of flour. I sat and watched my kids eat for 10 minutes as the prepared the spaghetti. My kids (10,4) were very patient but they should have offered to bring out their meals if mine was taking time. They gave me my meal (ge thanks) but I think they should have compt the entire check. 2 stars for the poor server who was very nice. I still tipped her 20% on the TOTAL before my meal was removed. Get it together guys! I understands things happen but when you make someone wait so long then bring out nasty food, it&#39;s just unacceptable! Now for the worst part.....I threw up multiple times and had diarrhea all night! What a rough night! <br><br>Only be back to pick up to go cheesecake! Oh and I have never in my life sent back a dish to any establishment. I can usually get threw it and learn my lesson.

One of my favorite places ever since I went the first time. Love to have lunch there and of course I can never skip the dessert. I have taken friends and family members and they love it just as much as I do! Can&#39;t wait for the next visit.

I have mixed feeling about the CCF. <br><br>On one hand I like to get a good sized portion of food. After all I do enjoy eating, but the portions here are grown up sizes on crack. <br><br>There is really no need for THAT much food unless you are a homeless person who saved up all there days &#34;salary&#34; to buy a meal that could last you all week.<br><br>The cheesecake is good, but I always suggest getting it to go. After eating half my meal there isn&#39;t too much room left for dessert.

We were seated on the patio...the FREEZING patio.  And the heater next to us didn&#39;t work.  And when we asked to move inside they told us it would be another half hour.  The server was amazing but the atmosphere was completely lacking.  Don&#39;t seat the patio if it&#39;s cold outside.

Terrible place to go to eat. My wife left a review on our way out of this place (I can&#39;t in good conscience call it a restaurant). Our server was switched to another station so we got a new one right when our meals came out. My $27.95 steak dinner was cold. Steak, potatoes, and green beans were all cold. Like ice box cold. Didn&#39;t eat it. After taking a taste of the ice cold steak, I had lost my appetite. Put my napkin over the meal and waited. Finally the new server came over, took my plate and said &#34;let me get this out of your way&#34; at which time I lifted the napkin and told her it arrived cold. She took it away and soon after a manager showed up asking if I wanted it remade. I told him no I just wanted to leave. He offered us some cheesecake which we declined. If my dinner was cold, the cheesecake might show up hot. He took off the price of my dinner from the check. I left no tip and wrote on the receipt &#34;You are lucky I paid for what I did&#34;. I will never, ever return.

Checked in over the weekend for Saturday lunch.  It&#39;s pretty much busy but straight away we were seated. <br>The menu was huge and I felt reading my text book for the exam. :)<br>Started with crab bites and chicken Samasos (Indian style).<br>Main course <br>Louisiana chicken pasta - perfectly cooked and liked the way chicken is grilled.<br>Bang Bang chicken and shrimp - I can say WOW for everything, the way it&#39;s presented and also the taste. The gravy is taste of more coconut flavor and shrimp is cooked properly. In the middle of the plate, the rice is topped with chopped peanuts and cilantro.<br>Coming to the dessert, we have no clue about the order. Finally we asked the staff who served us (I did remember her name RACHEL) and she suggested the fresh banana cream Cheese cake. The cake tastes superb.<br>The portions are good for what you pay and I felt the sodas are overpriced even though they have the refill option. <br>Friendly and attentive staff!!!!

I really love the food that The Cheesecake Factory has, however my fiancé and I have been to the Park Meadows one twice and BOTH times his food has went to other tables while mine was brought out. The first time it took about 15 minutes and we were okay as it was just the two of us eating at the bar. The bartender apologized but we didn&#39;t it comped (I work at Corporate for The Egg and I Restaurants) we wouldn&#39;t never allow a guest to pay for a meal that they didn&#39;t receive or was wrong in our error! We took a couple out to dinner on New Years Eve and it happened AGAIN this time the manager came over to apologize along with our waitress, it took over 25 MINUTES for his plate to come out, by this time out guests had already finished and mine was cold because I wasn&#39;t going to have him eat alone. Both times they did not give us a discount or atleast comp his meal, we still had to pay 20+ dollars for his meal! I am very disappointed in their costumer service!!

Service was fair, The food was below standard. Chicken Marsala with bow tie Pasta was hard and chewy, no sauce, and the chicken was dry. Chicken Alfredo The pasta was also hard and chewy almost like the dish was cooked earlier in the day then reheated, it was bad. We have frequented this particular location about 3-4 times per year, and feel it has taken a very bad turn in quality recently as this is not the first time this year the food was way below par. KFC in comparison would be five stars compared to the food that was served to us last night. We even got further confirmation as the table across from us was complaining about their food as well. I would not recommend this franchise location to anyone as they are in need of serious help and possibly inspection by the state on food prep. and storage.

We had a large group in for dinner and celebrate one of the player&#39;s 16th birthday. We had probably 20 in our party. Avg price per meal, not including cheesecake, with drinks is $20, so that&#39;s about $400 plus tip-give or take. One of the moms brought a birthday cake and we were not allowed to serve the cake without paying a fee. Really??? Obviously they hoped to get another $7 for a slice of cheesecake in addition to making a huge killing on our group. Customer service=0

we came into the restaurant at 12:30 on the day after Christmas. While we knew it would be busy especially with 13 people, but the hostess told us it would be about an hour. A even said it would be fine to split us up into two tables if needed. She said that would be fine and we could probably even get in faster. After waiting for 20 minutes, e checked and were told it was another 80 min. Wait. But they were working to get us altogether at one table.  we checked with them after an hour, we were told it was still another 20 min wait, which is what they said they told us in the beginning -WHICH WAS NOT TRUE. they tell you anything to get you in to wait and then push you offs avatar you have waited so long. A still got split up into two tables.

The food is decent(with very large portions), service is usually decent as well. On the other side of things it is always ridiculously loud, and if you are a party of 2 , you will  be seated at a table less than a foot away from the people next to you, close enough to hear them chew. From a place that costs near 50 dollars for 2 people to eat, I would expect to at least be able to have a conversation with the person across from me, without sharing all of the details with the 2 tables to my right and left. The server was also asking if we wanted boxes less than 5 minutes after our food came out, placing obvious emphasis on the fact that they are trying to get as many people in and out in an evening as possible. This made for a very uncomfortable environment for a meal. Definitely not in my picks for restaurants in the area.

My favorite here is the cheesecake variety. The bonus is the HUGE amount of food you get for your money. For a chain restaurant, they do that part right.<br><br>What I don&#39;t like are the crowds, the overwhelming menu, the often unexciting food taste, and the noise.

I would recommend this location rather than the one on the 16th street mall in downtown Denver. <br><br>I think there portions are bigger and it seems we dont wait as long here. <br><br>The food is good. I really like their chicken salad sandwhich. The chicken marsala dish is good. The mash potatoes are good. <br><br>Great place for groups and the cheesecake- so good!. Dont think we have ever gone here without getting cheescake to go.<br><br>Something for everyone here. Can&#39;t mess up a lot of the items either. I wouldnt get a drink here- alcohol I mean, a bit pricey.

Me and my boyfriend decided to go here and sit on the patio and enjoy the scenery. We did end up waiting a while to be seated. Cheesecake factory has such a big menu and so that is why I enjoy coming here because there is all types of food to eat.  Long story short our food was pretty good but the service was just really bad. It took them forever to come over to our table and once they did, well first let me expand on saying they. We had two servers that we were thrown back and forth between. We wait to order for a ridiculously long time and that is how we met our second server. Second server then brought us bread which you do get first thing or at least everyone else around us did. He took our order saying that he would fill in for her while she was on her dinner break. A. how tacky is it to tell us that the reason why she didnt take your guys order and you have been sitting here for 20 minutes is because she went to eat and didnt say anything to us. Then ended up she help us once at the end.  Just overall we were not expecting that experience and that will probably detour us from picking the cheesecake factory again out of the blue. Can get better service somewhere else and we want the whole package. The food here is always great tho.

Leave this one well alone if you&#39;ve ever been to a decent Cheesecake Factory, such as in Irvine or Houston for example. Just rotten food at top prices. I could go into detail, but oh why bother. One redeeming factor.. friendly waitresses.

Not sure exactly what the hype of this place is....<br><br>The wait is long and chaotic at best.<br><br>Food is so so and HUGE!!! Not sure I need all that salad. You can easily split a dish among three people.<br><br>Don&#39;t think i&#39;ll be going back anytime soon.

I love the Cheesecake Factory.  I make it a point to visit one where ever I am.  However on this particular visit (or maybe just to this particular Cheesecake Factory) the food was a little less then excellent.  I won&#39;t say that it was bad but not their normal best.  I ordered Miso Salmon.....what I always seem to order.  The salmon was a bit dry and the rice a little undercooked.  What saved the dish was the Miso sauce which just makes the dish yummy.

We got a gift card for Christmas and went to use it the weekend before Valentine&#39;s Day. Or not...90 minute wait at 6PM on a Saturday night, no thank you. So, we went back on Sunday the 26th around 2PM as we were in the area. We were told 35 minutes, which we were fine with as we were able to run through the mall to get things done to kill the time. We were seated near a server station which was busy with bussers and wait staff constantly. About 10 minutes after being seated, I asked our waitress to see the manager and proceeded to explain to him that we his bus boys were hanging out at the station cussing and being disrespectful toward other staff, to the point that the female staff were visibly upset. One waitress even walked by and apologized to us after a bus boy flung the cabinet doors open and forcefully pulled chairs and stools out of it slamming them around at the edge of our table. Manager was polite, as well as appreciative and said it would be handled. Funny, our lunch was very quiet after that and we rarely saw the bus boys even enter the area. <br>As for the food, I had the Pasta Carbonara and she had the Chicken Bellagio. Both dishes were lacking their usually flavor, as they are, respectively, our favorites. <br>They really need to do something about the wait times. No reservations is a thing of the past. Not necessarily thinking I&#39;ll go back anytime soon unless family wants to go.

What a regret! A regret that I did not send my onion rings and california philly back to the kitchen.  The onion rings were under fried even though I asked for them well done.  Waitress didn&#39;t care.  I asked if the meat was lean in the philly and the waitress said yes.  It was the fattiest  awful sandwich I&#39;ve had in a long time.  Told waitrees it was layered in fat and she didn&#39;t care.  Now why oh why didn&#39;t I sent it back!  Wimp!!!The biggest waste of $20.00 on a long time.  Never will be back.

Worst service tonight ever. Drove out just for pumpkin pecan cheesecake, 9 months pregnant. Spent $80 on a dinner for two, when it came time to order dessert we were told the pumpkin pecan cake was sold out. Bummer. On our way out I saw 4 slices displayed in the case (as if not sold out) I asked if they were reserved, I was told they were out-period. I asked why are they displayed, and was still denied, it was 10:30 pm so not like they needed the cake in case any longer. this was my favorite place, I will never go back. Jerks.

I have eaten here countless times and while the food is good, I have NEVER gotten good service.  It&#39;s gotten to the point where I start craving cheescake and have to prepare myself for a frustrating expereince.  I&#39;ve literrally gotten chicken sliders where the kitchen forgot the chicken and the waitstaff was reluctant to have it remade !!!  I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s up with the servers.  They certainly don&#39;t want for tips, with cheesecake my tickets are usually $75+

I have always loved the Cheesecake Factory!! It never disappoints, it&#39;s so popular that at 2:30pm there is a 30min wait for a arty of two...that has to be my only complaint cause I hate waiting regardless of the location! Be careful here, all the meals are excellent, appetizers too! But the portions are so large by the time you are ready for their famous cheesecake...you&#39;re stuffed! I recommend eating half the entree, box it and enjoy some desert there, have the rest of entree later! The only other think keeping from a 5star, don&#39;t expect a lot of privacy, many tables move easily and they can sit you very close to others, the environment is a little noisy, just be prepared! Also it&#39;s at the mall...parking is crazy!
Good food and atmosphere.  Their selection of alcohol is lacking though.

I&#39;m giving this chain restaurant FIVE stars, which is unusual for me! The cheesecake factory is always a solid choice in my book. The service is consistently prompt, friendly, and attentive - every time. I give Cheesecake Factory a lot of credit for that! Also, the food is delicious. My favorite entree is the Louisiana chicken pasta - breaded white meat chicken, bow tie pasta, peppers and mushrooms in a somewhat spicy sauce. It is absolutely yummy in the tummy!! I also love the salads - each one that I try is great. The burgers are also a huge treat. Seriously, I think just about everything I&#39;ve tried at Cheesecake Factory, I have enjoyed. Of course, we can&#39;t forget the wonderful desserts. I love the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake - it is decadent deliciousness. I also love the strawberry shortcake. Oh man - who is hungry?? ME!!! I&#39;m craving some Cheesecake Factory. Right. About. Now!!!!

This is, by far, one of my favorite places to eat.  The food is just *that* good. Don&#39;t be confused by the name, it is a full-blown restaurant and not just dessert. The menu is HUGE, which can be a problem if you are hungry because you might want everything.  I love many things on the menu, but a few favorites are:<br>The Corn Fritters<br>Cashew Chicken<br>Avocado Eggrolls<br>Club Sandwich<br><br>Try to get the lunch specials whenever possible.  The meals are very, very large.  You could easily share one of their meals with three people and be full.  I have to admit to eating one by myself often, but not because I should (if you know what I mean).<br><br>The cheesecake is good and they have more than 20 varieties.

-Our server was really for lack of a better word corporatized.... very much like a drone.  One of many reasons I dislike corporate chains... I also think that an all white outfit is awful!  IT LOOKS HORRIBLE!  Everyone&#39;s uniform was dirty!<br>The menu is way to freaking big... and the tackiest thing in the world is the ads throughout the menu.  It was distracting! Our small plates were good, not great. <br>Our food.... seriously.... Way to big... Ray got a double cheeseburger with onion rings and BBQ sauce. IT was RIDICULOUS! 3 slices of bread raw onions (which were actually horrible and contained an entire layer of the rubbery skin) onion rings 2 large patties, 2 pieces of thick, thick cheese and fixings... It stood a foot high! How the heck can you possibly eat that??  <br>My shrimp and bacon club was equally ridiculous! 3 pieces of bread and two different kinds of mayo like sauces.... they both were horrible. My friend club was ridiculous as well!  It was stacked up just as tall as the cheeseburger.  <br>I think the quality of food is much more important than the size... This is one of those places where I would love to see the calorie count...especially on the burger.<br>The cheesecake is of course amazing... <br>I like the option to sub out the side of French Fries without charge.  <br><br>I did not love my meal at all I love dining with friends.  I enjoyed that.  And the music playing is good!!  <br>I will probably just come in for dessert next time... if there is a next time...
Really bad experience here tonight. Salads had rotten lettuce   We used to live the Chinese chicken salads her but tonight was horrible.

To be fair we never got seated so my review is solely based on how we were mistreated by the host staff, and does not reflect the food or wait staff in any way. My husband and I stopped in for an early dinner while shopping at Park Meadows. It was a little before five, but there was a huge crowd of people waiting inside and out. The hostess who greeted us had colorful hair and her attitude was just as vibrant. When we checked in she told us it wouldn&#39;t be more than a few minutes because it was only the two of us and we would be seated very soon, she asked us to wait nearby for our name to be called and we were not given a pager. We waited patiently but started wondering why all the couples and groups who checked in after us were being called and seated. After about a fifteen minute wait my husband went back to the host table where a young male told us. &#34;We know you&#39;re waiting just go back to where you were.&#34; He knew that we were overlooked, however did not offer an apology or suggest that we would be the next to be seated. Not only was his attitude extremely rude, but I want to add that the fact that my husband and I were the only Asians in the waiting area may have been a factor in our non-seating. Anyway, had many good experiences at the Cheesecake Factory in Hawaii, but will never give them my business in Denver.
My girlfriends and I come here almost once a week. The food is delicious, the staff/service is even better, and the restaurant is always so clean!
Great service, loved the avocado egg roll.

This was my first time here and I loved It!<br><br>First I need to say My brother and his Girl work for the CCF in Vegas but this one is in Co and they did not give me coupons or a discount or anything (I wish they would however )<br><br>I ordered the Shrimp Scampi/Chicken Maidera platter the mash patatoes were addictive so yummy as was the chicken and the Scampi sauce.<br><br>The reason they lost a star was for the method of cooking on the shrimp.<br><br>I am a chef (Retired to go back to teaching after I injured my arm on the job)so, excuse my nit picking but I MUST critique thier techninue.<br><br>The shrimp is seared to perfection and the texutre is perfect! but, because when they seared it they did not add the sauce to the pan there is no flavor seared in.<br><br>So while the shrimp was perfectly cooked it had no flavor since searing removed it&#39;s nature flavor.<br><br>The sauce was so good (I wanted to lick my plate) it was wasted on the shrimp that served as a spoon to simply enjoy the sauce flavor .<br><br>Other than that, everything was Heavenly! the server was sweet and attentive even when my son was acting silly and she was trying to understand what he was saying but he was talking in nonsense langauge so I said &#34;just ignore him he is nuts &#34; and she says &#34;ok&#34; and walks away later when she came back she said I am the oldest of 6 I know &#34;nutty kids&#34; and we laughed she was so pleasant!<br><br>I LOVE that when, the food is good the staff is great every one is doing thier job and loving it! oh, and it was my &#34;early&#34; birthday dinner so, they sang Happy Birthday and two of the staff members were holding hands while they sang and being silly afterwards it was so cute! I love to see people who are truly happy with thier jobs! it spreads to all thier customers! When you can have fun at work it says so much about you and the company you work for.<br><br>Cheese Cake Factory you have a new &#34;regular&#34; The idea that they have mixed  two of my favorite things (kaula and cheesecake) together was mind blowing and they did not dissapoint! I am afraid I will prob never try any other flavor because that one was so Good! I might go back before the end of my vacation and buy some for the freezer for bad days no, in fact I MUST go back and get some for the freezer! that might save some ones&#39; life LOL when I feel like killing some one I can talk myself down by promising myself a slice of Kaula cheese cake (yummy!)

I went to the Cheesecake Factory with my kids for Father&#39;s Day.  The food and service were fantastic!  I live in Colorado Springs but always make a point to stop and eat here with the family when I&#39;m in the Denver area.  The food and service are awesome everytime and we always take some good Cheesecake to go :)

75-90 minute wait on Saturday but the place didn&#39;t even look like it was packed! We ended up not waiting as long and by the time we sat down and ordered our food, it really got busy! Thank god for raspberry martinis. They are so addicting. Then we had the three cheese pasta but substitute it with Alfredo sauce and breaded chicken. Even the servers were wanting to try this combination. Our server was okay. We didn&#39;t really see her much till dessert time but she was nice. We had the chocolate tuxedo cheesecake which was delicious!

The quality of the food is great and consistent. The seating is somewhat cramped and on busy days its hard to get good service. The chicken and biscuits is great and the portions are generous. The restaurant is located by the parking lot and easy to find good parking. You will not be disappointed by this restaurant

Special thanks to our server Anthony, great food, great service and thanks for putting up with our kids ( the couple next to us moved tables), The kids really like the sliders and the banana  cheesecake  desert was worth all the calories!

I have eaten here several times, and I have never been disappointed.  All the servers have tried most of the entrees, so they are able to give their opinion and can give great suggestions.  The service is great and the food has always been great.  The sandwiches are excellent and the portions are huge.  The Louisiana pasta dish is to die for and the cheesecake ain&#39;t so bad either.  For a chain restaurant that is moderately priced, you cannot go wrong here.

My husband and I love to go to the Cheesecake Factory! The atmosphere is decadent and overstated; but, hey...I love the real marble floors and white cloth napkins at lunch! They have me at the cheesecake counter when I walk in and I don&#39;t even order dessert most times when I eat there. However, they do a terrific job on cheesecake and I like the firmness of their texture. The Red Velvet is A+. I adore the soup and salad for a light lunch and the Sunday brunch is a real treat. Their menu reads like a book and I can always find something I want. I really like to order a couple of appetizers and then go for the cheesecake! ENJOY!

Stopped in for Easter Dinner with the familt. Our meals were horrible. The Cajun Pasta had not taste and Evelyn&#39;s Pasta tasted like hospital type food. I have eaten at Cheesecake Factory Restaurants all over the United States and this one has he worst food I have ever eaten. Don&#39;t waste your time or money pick another restaurant.

A bunch of us met  for an early lunch last weekend  to catch up with the latest going on&#39;s. The CF has so many items on their menu that dinning with a large group allows you to  see/taste a larger selection without multiple trips.  My cobb salad was generous in portion  and tasted fine but I don&#39;t think I would reorder. (Champs has the best Cobb in Denver ).  The Chinese Chicken entree is a real winner - skip the Chinese chicken salad as they are completely different.  Sure the sodas are all you can drink but at $4 for lemonade I opted for the healthy water alternative.  Service was pretty good and the conversation was engaging.  Not my pick for the next gathering and an expensive locale for those that don&#39;t crave their $7 per slice cheesecake.

I thought I&#39;d never have to write one of these for the cheesecake factory. It all started when we got sit at our table. Its just my wife and I at a table of four with one chair missing which isn&#39;t that big of a deal because there&#39;s only two of us not four but no place for my wife to sit down do to the fact that some lady at the other table at her chair pushed all the way practically into our table. Our waiter took our order in a timely fashion even gave us the lunch special after lunch time. So things seem to be going into a positive direction,  When are pizzas and salad arrived my wife&#39;s didn&#39;t show up so he had to go back and grab hers and my Hawaiian pizza had no pineapple. I was joking with my wife and said watch he will probably just throw some pineapple on it. Sure enough that&#39;s exactly what happened cold pineapple pieces. I gave it back to the waiter and said I wasn&#39;t interested he said he be heated for me I said no they should&#39;ve done it right the first time. As a manager showed up he come comp my meal  obviously because I didn&#39;t have the pizza. And the clincher this all as they overcooked my wife&#39;s undercooked mine, And My wife said she could hear the busboys in the background laughing about them not bring her salad out and after we left we both got deathly sick, Since we both had the salads were thinking that they weren&#39;t even wash Properly.

I had not been to a Cheesecake Factory in quite a few years and now I remember why. For the cost you would expect this place to have wonderful food and outstanding service, which is pretty much the opposite of what we experienced. The service is terrible! The waitress seemed less than interested in our table even though she could have likely made a whole lot more money in drinks (and subsequent tips alone) she didn&#39;t even care to keep the water full. Rule #1 of serving, don&#39;t let your guests run out of liquid. Rule #2, ask them if they want another drink... For as slow as it was you would think this was part of the &#39;slow food movement&#39;, but no. On top of that I ordered the tempura and they didn&#39;t even have chopsticks. Seriously? How hard is it to keep chopsticks in stock? And to make matters worse there was a terrible mess in one of the stalls and another door that doesn&#39;t lock. Bathrooms are a must to keep in order, especially in a restaurant. You don&#39;t want to go into a bathroom to such a disgusting mess while you&#39;re eating. UGH!!! For a meal that cost my husband and I 75$ I expected better than this. I&#39;m terribly disappointed.

Cheesecake Factory has great Chicken Madeira dish which is one of their most popular dishes (comes with mashed potatoes and asparagus, white-meat chicken tenderloins well seasoned, mushroom sauce). Great cheesecakes, my personal favorite are Tiramisu Cheesecake and White Chocolate Raspberry. Although because they serve so much food (their portions are very large) plus basket of tasty bread to start with, I rarely have room for desert.

I know it&#39;s a chain restaurant,...but its soooooo goooood! The best veggie pizza I&#39;ve ever had is to be eaten here. It&#39;s HUGE!! Enough for two people to share, which is exactly what I did. I got the Veggie Pizza with goat cheese. The pizza had mushrooms, tomatoes, onions, artichoke hearts, kalmata olives and herbs. It&#39;s sooo scrumptious!! After the pizza we ordered the summer raspberry lemon cheesecake. OMG...it was like a sweet light and tangy cloud in your mouth! LOVED it! The only reason I didn&#39;t give 5 stars, is the service. The hostess was super nice and talkative. Our server on the other hand...:0( She was odd. She seemed to question what I would ask for and didn&#39;t seem to have any personality. She wasn&#39;t able to hear me when I spoke, from what I can assume, because she would lean in REAL close and stare at my mouth when I spoke. I found it kind of uncomfortable, even though I was trying to speak loudly and clearly. It is pretty loud in the dining area. So...other than that, my dining experience was great! The menu is soooo huge! I wonder how many cooks are back there! Another great thing they offer is the Skinnilicious menu for those watching their diet. But if you&#39;re gonna go to the Cheesecake Factory...you may as well go ALL OUT! :0) But it&#39;s a great idea. I&#39;ll definitely be back for the pizza. YUM!

Love that there&#39;s a huge variety of food choices. The big portions are great and easy to share. I&#39;ve never had something I didn&#39;t like. The atmosphere is great and the servers are all fantastic. We even got free dessert one time when the wait was too long. And oh the desserts. The cheesecake is great as one would expect. Try the apple dumpling a la mode if you get a chance. Mmmmmmm.

I was very disappointed in the quality of service we received at the Cheesecake Factory. Our waitress kept rushing off before we could order, our daughter&#39;s food was ready and already eaten by the time we were able to order our own meals, and despite being upfront about my onion allergy, we couldn&#39;t get a straight answer from her on what was safe to eat. Believe me, they won&#39;t be getting our patronage again.
You have to try their new Vietnamese tacos. Excellent starter. You know it is good when your love it too. :-)

I&#39;ve been to this location multiple times and have never had a bad experience...until my last visit.<br> <br>It was about 9pm on a Friday so it was busy. There was about a 15 minute wait. The bread was rock hard. We ordered what we usually order but it was not the same. The calamari was chewy and my hubby swore he bit into something that tasted like plastic. We ordered a pasta to share and my son ordered his own pasta. Well they brought them out together and as soon as they went to hand us ours we realized that is not what we ordered. So the girl took it back and few minutes go by and our waiter says &#34;im sorry i know you said you wanted the louisanna but i wrote down chipotle.&#34; As he was apologizing what appeared to be a manager tried to bring us back the same WRONG dish. So our waiter told him that it wasnt right, so he takes it back again. Another ten minutes go by before we get the right meal and my son is just about finished with his. Having ordered appitzers, drinks and dessert you&#39;d think hey maybe they&#39;d discount the meal they messed up? No, of course not I&#39;m paying full price when i just ate rock hard bread, chewy calamari and my pasta dish after my son was finished. Obviously I&#39;m disappointed, this place usually is top notch.

Everyone knows this chain has good desserts, and the prices are not too bad. At this particular location, service has become a low priority. The overwhelming majority of the staff are very young and poorly trained. The weird hair, tattoos, etc, are just part of being at the mall, but the atmosphere of ignoring customers is irritating. I&#39;ve seen it on 2 visits in the last month. You have to interrupt someone to get on the waiting list, or to order something to go, etc. At the first visit, we waited 30 minutes for a table one evening even though we could see 4 or 5 empty tables at times. The second time, I went in to preorder a cheesecake for my upcoming anniversary. They took all my information, etc, arranging that I would pick it up about 5 pm in 2 days, and have an anniversary message on a piece of chocolate (they don&#39;t put messages on the cake itself I was told). When I came to pick it up, they had apparently done little or nothing to get it ready. I had to wait while they got a pre made cake from the freezer, frosted it, put on the topping, etc. Oh, and no chocolate, or message. So, what was the purpose of ordering it ahead of time? This took so long I didn&#39;t ask questions but paid and left. The entertainment, while I waited for 20 minutes, was watching 2 cashiers trying to reconcile the cash drawer. They couldn&#39;t agree on the total, and would count it out again. Each time, they counted a ten dollar bill as a twenty. My hint was ignored or too subtle. They had to get a third person (adult, probably supervisor) to break the tie. Another negative factor in my mind is the incredible noise level - not just conversations, but banging dishes, etc.<br><br>So on balance, I will only rarely be at this establishment, but the food is very good usually.

My sister and I ordered 2 side salads and nachos. Our salads came out quickly, and we ate them. 20 min. Later, our nachos still hasn&#39;t come out. Our waitress said they burned the first order. 10 min later we still didn&#39;t have them. At that point we had to leave bc we had somewhere to be. We couldn&#39;t find our waiter, so we went to the bar to have them remove the nachos from our bill. She went to get the manager. The manager was standing right next to us and never apologized or even acknowledged us for that matter. We left hungry and upset. What ever happened to customer service??? When I used to work in the restaurant industry, we would do our best to try and make sure the customer came back especially if we messed something up.

The food was delicious.  I ordered the lettuce wraps (asian style) for an appetizer, a combo shrimp and salmon entree and the banana creme cheesecake for dessert.  No complaints on the prices.  I&#39;ve noticed that they recently have options for smaller and healthier appetizers and entrees.  Although I think &#34;smaller&#34; is just right for me.  My ONLY complaint is the way they try to stuff as many people as possible in that stretch of small tables.  My boyfriend and I had a tough time enjoying our dinner and conversation because 5 minutes after we were seated, the hostess seated a group of loud teenage girls who were having a great time and couldnt stop talking. They were (no kidding) about a foot away from us.  It was on a weekday night, with PLENTY of open tables and booths around the restaurant. I wish the hostess could have been a little more considerate and rotated to another server&#39;s section also because our waiter ended up having two tables to serve right after another. Next time, we will request a booth.

My wife and I eat here at least two times a month. The only drawback is knowing when to go when you will not have to wait forever or it is packed with kids. But, we only have had one problem in the last ten visits, and the problem was resolved. The food is great, large portions, at least two meals worth. We ate at the bar the last time we went and the bartender was the best waiter we have ever had there. People rave on the cheesecake, and it is good, but we love their chocolate fudge cake.

My girlfriend and I went there last Saturday night.  When we got there, it was a 40 minute wait for a table.  We went to the bar to grab some drinks and decided to stay there.  40 minute wait turned into a 2 minute wait.  The two bartenders, Dorian and Eric, were two of the most professional and social bartenders I have ever encountered.  They made the bar experience very enjoyable.  The food and cheesecake, as always, were good.  This visit reminded me of how professional everything is here.

My daughter and her friends went to this restaurant before their winter formal.  It was an all girl group.  They got there at 5pm and were told they would be seated in an hour and fifteen minutes.  Over two hours later they were finally seated.  They had to rush through dinner to make it to the formal on time.  When they got the bill, my daughter&#39;s $13 pasta dish mysteriously cost $21, which is too much even counting tax and gratuity (she did not order a drink).  She said that they couldn&#39;t take the time to fight it because they were running so late.  One girl was shorted on her change and told by the server that the restaurant had run out of change.  Quite honestly, this restaurant took advantage of these kids and provided outrageously bad and even dishonest service.  I will never go to this restaurant again and I&#39;m quite sure none of these girls or their families will either.
The Georgia peach drinks is wonderful. The fish tacos rock, best ever, so much flavor. And the stephanys red velvet cheesecake.....omg!

If you are at Park Meadows during lunch time Tuesday-Saturday, head to the Cheesecake Factory, sit at the bar, and let Darren take excellent care of you.  I am a pain in the neck when it comes to food due to allergies and sensitivities and they accommodate me without batting an eye.  When you have food allergies eating out can be scary, but I have eaten there at least once a week for the past year and have NEVER, EVER had a problem! Darren is a sweetheart and treats his customers like gold.  Head on down, you won&#39;t be sorry!

The Cheesecake factory. That is exactly what it is, the place you go when you want good cheesecake. Unfortunately, I have yet to find any other reason to visit. I have been to the Cheesecake Factory on two separate occasions, at two different locations. My first experience was not good, but figured I would try it again since so many people seem to enjoy it. Let me first start by commenting on their menu. The menu is 15 pages long, which to some may seem like a good thing, as there are so many choices to pick from. In my opinion, the menu is so extensive that it hints at the fact that they don&#39;t specialize in any type of food. My girlfriend and I had their sliders and pizza, figuring they were simple enough items that the cheesecake factory couldn&#39;t possibly screw them up. I was wrong. The meat in the first (of 4)sliders I picked up, barely filled half the one and a half inch bun, and looked and tasted like it was literally heated up in a microwave and then thrown into the bun with absolutely no care at all by the cooks. The other 3 were not much to write home about, being mainly greasy and lacking taste. The &#34;everything&#34; pizza came out and was even worse. Not only was it barely room temperature when it came to the table, but was created in such a way that it literally looked like a 2 year old had taken the ingredients and thrown it randomly on the pizza. The taste was not enjoyable, and was definitely not worth the money spent. The food ordered by our friends at the table was similarly disappointing and all agreed was overpriced for the quality. The strawberry cheesecake was the only part of the meal that was actually enjoyable.<br><br>In conclusion, I do not plan on returning to the Cheesecake factory again for anything other than Cheesecake; and do not recommend to anyone who is looking a good meal. Perhaps the factory could cut down its menu, and actually specialize in a certain type of food instead of specializing in offering a large menu of low quality food.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory for my daughters birthday last week. 3 members of our party got food poisoning. I called the restaurant to notify them and the manager basically responded that they had served 1000 people the night before and it was impossible that we got sick because of their food. I have worked in corporate American for 25 years, first of all it is possible and it is what happened to be food poisoning was confirmed by our doctor. Secondly, the manager said he would call back after investigating and he didn&#39;t. Third of all, it could be a health hazard for other customers and should have been taken seriously. After reading other yelp posts about the lack of cleanliness, I am not surprised we got sick. So beware, we got 3 seafood type dishes.  I would avoid this restaurant but if you do go avoid any seafood dishes. And to the manager that didn&#39;t take my call seriously, some customers will go the extra mile to let others know when they have a bad experience because we care about other people and do not want the same thing happening to them.

favorite restaurant of alllll time! the lemon chicken piccata and the bbq ranch chicken salad...nothing like them! absolutely recommend this place to anyone! great clean place with a smiling happy staff!

I have 25 years in customer service and I have to agree with the other reviews--this place needs to be cleaned A LOT!  When we were shown to our outdoor table, there were bird droppings on the chair!  Yuck!  I moved my chair and got another chair without the hostess asking me why!  We were there at &#34;happy hour&#34;.  I asked about the 2 for 1 drinks and was informed that I had to be seated &#34;at the bar for this special&#34; even though there were signs all over the place that at 4 pm you can get 2 for 1 drinks.   Really--wow what great customer service!! Sarcasm galore on the last sentence.  Needless to say they did not get my money on their alcoholic drinks.   If my husband didn&#39;t have a gift certificate that was given to him by his work, we would have walked out.  The only saving grace was Erika our server (she was NOT the one who told us about the 2 for 1 drinks debacle).  She was happy, solicitous and friendly.  She did not stand around like 3 other servers did--she actually worked.  Food was ok-not great but that was not her fault.  This place needs to close down for a couple days and use some elbow grease and clean up the bird crap.

Usually when i go to a restaurant like this in this area my wife and I are treated like we won&#39;t leave a tip. That was 100% the opposite of my experience. They went above and beyond, even brought out warm water for my 6 month old five stars you deserve six. f.y.i we did tip over 20% as we always do when it is deserved.

The appetizers were great. I had ordered a veggie burger and it was not so tasty as I was hoping for, for the price that I was paying for it. Their dessert is great. Drinks are yummy. Just the burger that ruined it for me. A little pricey for what they have to offer.

Yum, Yumm, Yummy!  I forgot how good this place is!!  I sometimes will pass it up as I think it&#39;s too pricey but as we had a gift card we figured we&#39;d give it a go.  First off, it&#39;s not nearly as pricey as I thought it was and for the amount of food they give you it&#39;s well worth the menu prices!  The atmosphere is nice, even though it&#39;s attached to the mall.  Our waiter, Matt, was helpful and attentive even though it was a quite busy evening.  The menu is large so go with your gut or ask your waiter/waitress to recommend - they actually have had the food and do know a thing or two!  My boyfriend got a house salad to start, which was a fresh bed of mixed greens and huge so we split it.  For our entrees he opted for the buffalo chicken sandwich w/ fries and I got the Tomato basil pasta.  We couldn&#39;t believe our eyes when our plates came!  His sandwich was ENORMOUS and the breading they use was perfectly crisp.  My pasta was amazing as well.  We both ended up taking leftovers home to be had the next day - reheated it was still damn good!  Oh and I forgot how much I love their brown bread that they give you.  I DEF won&#39;t be passing this place up too much in the future.  Too bad with all that yummy food we didn&#39;t even have room for cheesecake or the strawberry shortcake the couple next to us had  that I drooled over as we left!

I ate here a couple weeks ago, for dinner. My first time. They are very good. Service was excellent. Food portions are large. They tell you the food portions will be large, and they were correct.  They have a very large menu too, with a little of everything. My wife and I felt they are a little expensive, but they are good and we enjoyed eating there. It is a great looking place. Plenty of noise in the restaurant. I ordered a blackened chicken sandwich which was very good and quite large.  My wife ordered the grilled eggplant sandwich which she said she loved.  We will go there again when, if ever, we are not worried too much about the calorie count.  We&#39;ve been told a lot of people order side dishes and share. This definitely could be a good place for sharing. We enjoyed it.
Great place, expensive food and long wait times. They have reduced the quantity of food, in the past there was always stuff left to pack.

This place is always packed, especially on the weekends. Despite this, their service is impeccable and the food is fairly delicious. I highly recommend the Mahi Mahi and you just CANNOT leave The Cheesecake Factory without an order of cheesecake a la mode!
